choices: No guild for me just yet...
1.content: The city of guilds awaits, but before you can begin you need to choose a gender and faction.
1.title: Welcome To Ravnica!

11.content: Good, now choose a guild.
11.title: For Order!

choices: Tell her you'll deliver the mail
Tell her to deliver it herself
Ask for a favor in return
111.content:
You moved your quill back and forth with such haste that most passersby only caught a glimpse of your hand as you stacked scrolls or stamped various paperwork with the guild seal. It had only been a few days since you had been accepted into the pristine Azorious Senate and already you had an entire desk full of work completed and filed... all in a timely manner of course.

As you worked a young woman name Keli walked over and dropped a small sealed envelope on your desk as she signed a length of parchment with a levitating quill. "Hey, I just got this from a messenger griffon, can you deliver it please?" she said as she motioned with her hand and sealed the document she had been writing on with a brief flash of blue light. "I just got saddled with an extra set of important papers and it'll take a while to file them..."

You ignore her for a moment as you shuffle through some documents of your own before looking up to meet her eyes. Before today you had only seen her a few times and barely had the chance to say hi, though she certainly seemed to be a hard worker. Still, you have a ton of work yourself and falling behind could greatly delay your advancement in the guild...
111.title: You've Got Mail

choices: I want to join the civil branch.
I want to join the judicial branch.
1112.content:
"Keli as much as I'd like to be your little errand boy, I'm a bit too preoccupied with this sea of paper work that's before me." You say while filling out a paper on a recent vehicular accident, involving a run away Izzet experiment, a small Rakdos demon, and a giant frog trying to eat said demon. Luckily no citizen was harmed, but the Simic who owned the frog, reported it had heart burn, and decided to pursue a legal case against against the Izzet who's experiment got out of had.

"But I really would like you to deliver this for me." She said, giving you a wink. To which you processed to inform her that if she really wants it to be delivered, all she has to do is give it to one of the many birds we employ for that specific task. To which she leaves to your work, looking a little disheartened.

Now that she was out of the way, you put all of your attention into your documents. It was tough trying to become a full fledged lawmage. Some time later while you worked, your supervisor and chief lawyer, Bill came by with a question concerning your future. "Hey kid, you've been working here and I've been wondering which branch of the law you're going to pursue, the civil aspect of the law, or the judicial aspect of it?"
1112.title: Tell her to deliver it herself

choices: "No, I'm free for the next few hours."
"What kind of plans did you have in mind?"
11121.content:
You take a moment to think as Bill leans up against a nearby support pillar and crosses his arms. "I think I'll be a part of the civil branch, I've already done a lot of studying and I think I could do pretty good." you say as you finish up the last of your daily paperwork and lock up your desk. "On that note I think I'll retire for the evening, it'll be getting dark soon and I don't want to get caught outside at night, especially with those damn Rakdos cultists just a few blocks away."

Bill nods his head and turns to one of the large nearby windows. "I should be wrapping things up too, whatever career you decide to pursue I'm sure you'll be a fine addition to our guild. See me early tomorrow if you get the chance and maybe we can talk about a promotion, you've certainly earned it by now." he says as you take one final inventory of everything at your desk and put your key away. "Thanks boss, I won't disappoint you." you reply as you go to leave.

As you near the main doors you see Keli waiting at the front desk wearing a blue hood outfit. You wave to her and walk over as she finishes her conversation with one of the secretaries. "Hello again Keli, did you get that letter delivered?" you ask as she waves goodbye to the secretary. "Yeah, I did." she replies with a frown. "But I'm behind on my work now, it took me an hour to find out who to give it to and and hour to hunt them down."

"Sorry about that, but I had my own work to do." you reply as her expression softens a little. "It's fine." she replies with a sigh. "It was a top priority letter and I couldn't just trust it to some messenger, I'd lose my job if it got lost or damaged. Honestly, I'm more mad that it was brought to me instead of one of the senior clerks. Anyway, I wanted to ask you... got any plans for tonight?"
11121.title: A Hard Day Of Work

choices: Tell her to sweeten the deal first
Tell her to find someone else
1113.content:
"I'm not a courier and I already have some work due in my inbox by the end of the day. What are you offering in exchange for this little errand?" you ask as you push aside a stack of documents to look over the small envelop. It was fairly ordinary aside from the expensive shimmering blue ink used to write the address. That as well as the Izzet guild emblem stamped on the front in bright red ink told you that this was indeed an important letter.

Keli bit her lip a bit as she tried to think. "I'm not high enough to offer you a direct promotion... but my friend and I were talking the other day about how the head of her office is a bit short-staffed at the moment. If you do this for me I'm sure I could put in a good word for you and help you get a higher ranking job." she finally said as she rested a hand on your desk. "I can't promise anything, though I'm sure someone as talented as you would make a good first impression."

You couldn't quite tell if she was being serious or just trying to flatter you into doing her work for her. Still, you were ahead enough of your own work that you could probably still do this task and have plenty of time to get all of your normal paperwork filed and turned in on time. Of course, you wouldn't get anything done by just sitting here all day thinking about it...
1113.title: The Proposition

choices: The office of permits and licenses
11131.content:
You take the letter and tuck it away as you get up from your desk. "Alright, I'll do this. Just don't forget to make that recommendation for me, I could really use it." you say as you lock up everything with your key to keep it safe while you were on this little errand. "Oh thank you, I was worried I'd end up behind. I won't forget this." Keli replies as she walks back towards her own desk.

"I guess getting a little exercise will be good." you say as you head out of the office area and step into the main hall. This was one of the larger Azorius outposts deep in Alliance territory, though it was still impressive how truly massive and polished everything was. If not for the blue carpets and banners North Gate Courthouse could easily be mistaken for an Orzhov building, such was its luxury.

You pass many other guild members as you walk down the long hallway to the room specified on the letter, from lowly scribes and officers all the way up to combat mages and judges. Even at this early hour the place was packed with thousands of people going about their various tasks and working hard towards a better Ravnica. "The Selesnya may think they know order, but they've got nothing on us." you say proudly as you admire the accomplishments and commendations of your fellow members chronicled on the walls as you pass.

After nearly twenty minutes of walking you turn down a branching hallway and head up a wide staircase to the third floor. "Let's see...where was that address at again?" you think to yourself as you pull out the letter to check it one more time. After making sure you were headed in the right direction you put the letter away and headed to...
11131.title: The Hall Of Law

choices: Check between the shelves of books
Check the upper floor on the far side of the room
111312.content:
"Ah good, its really close by." you say happily as you look up at the numbers above each of the doors lining the large hallway in front of you. "Number twenty four, should be just up ahead." you smiled as you looked out the giant glass windows facing the eastern side of the building and watched the mid morning light wash over the rooftops, towers and streets of your city.

Ravnica was quite beautiful at times, even with all of the corruption and lawbreakers infesting the nastier parts of it. If anything, it only made you feel more accomplished with the important services you were providing to the residents of this large territory. Order may not exist everywhere, especially at the present time, but it would certainly exist under the shadow of any location flying your guild's magnificent banner.

"Ah, here we are." you grin as you come upon door number twenty four and open it. The interior of the library was extravagant even by guild standards with a massive domed ceiling stretching nearly two hundred feet above the floor at its highest point. Towering shelves of books lined the inside of the room and tall stained glass windows gave everything a mystic and ethereal quality with its soft rays of light breaking the shadows.

You stood for nearly a minute in awe before you remembered that you still had a task to complete. All you had to do now was find the head librarian and deliver your message...
111312.title: Towers Of Tomes

choices: Rush over to see what happened
Run out into the hall and leave the scene
1113121.content:
You take a short tour through the shelves of books as you seek out the head librarian. There were a few other scholars and mages about, but many had their noses in scrolls and spellbooks looking for important information. Luckily, it wasn't long before you bumped into an older man with long brown hair and a short goatee. Even without the Azorius robes you'd recognize head librarian Delwin anywhere.

"Excuse me sir, I have an important letter for you, presumably from the Izzet." you say as you hand him the letter. He takes a quick look at it and smiles as he looks over the seal. "Ah yes, the Izzet are a strange lot but I'm sure its something important if they went to the trouble of sending a normal letter instead of some sort of prototype messenger golem or something. Thank you." he replies as he sits the letter on top of a stack of books he was carrying.

"You're most welcome, sir. If you'll excuse me I have to get back to my own duties." you say as you bow and excuse yourself. "Keep up the good work, I see big things in your future." Delwin calls as you begin heading for the main door. Just as you are about to step back out into the hallway a loud explosion echoed throughout the building. Several screams of horror and surprise follow as you slowly turn around to see the source of the commotion.

Your heart sank as thin trails of smoke began rising towards the big domed ceiling from the bookshelves were Delwin had been gathering tomes. A tiny orange glow peeked through the narrow spaces as several small objects fell to the floor with sharp thudding sounds. This was bad, very bad... what should you do?
1113121.title: Broken Silence

112.content:
You gaze in wonder over the table of armaments in front of you. Everything from knives and axes to spears and claymores were carefully aligned before you as a watchful quartermaster made sure nothing disappeared into the hands of an overeager recruit ready for blood. "Go on and pick a weapon, lad. The test will begin soon." he said as he put a withered hand on the table and leaned in to make sure you didn't steal something extra.

You briefly nodded your head in acknowledgement and returned your gaze to the wooden table and its shimmering weapons below. You had some sort of physical exam coming up before you could become an initiate in the guild and it was hard picking a weapon with no idea what you might face. Finally, you decide on...
112.title: Weapon Selection

1122.content:
You grab the warhammer with both hands and hoist it high over your head. Despite it only being about two and a half feet in length it easily weighted under fifty pounds due to an enchantment placed upon it by Boros battlemages. "Aye, that there hammer is a fine choice. Good luck to ya lad." the quartermaster says as the next potential recruit steps up to claim their weapon. You feel a bit uneasy as you look over the massive hunk of metal in your hands.

While you had experienced red magic in the past you could tell that this hammer was something unusual. Its inner core beat softly like a heart and it felt slightly warm to the touch. Whatever battles this thing had seen it was clear that the red mana bound to it was lusting for blood. Yet, even though you were somewhat disturbed by it... something about this hammer excited you. You somehow felt invincible as its power simmered at your fingertips.

The life of a Boros Legionary was tough and dangerous, maybe this warhammer was just what you needed? You could feel a fire inside yourself spark as a Boros commander walked into the room to greet the new meat. This was it, your first step to becoming an elite combat veteran charged with keeping the peace by any means necessary. You didn't know exactly what was ahead, but with this weapon you knew you were going to go far. A grim silence filled the room as the Boros commander greeted everyone and revealed the first test...
1122.title: Hammer Time!

choices: A big burly woman with a battleaxe
An armored goblin with a shield and spear
A muscular man with a large mace
11221.content:
The Boros commander was a fearsome looking man who appeared to be in his late forties or early fifties, though his steely expression and rugged face made it hard to be sure. He had dark skin and a very short head of hair that was slightly unkempt, possibly due to his tight fitting helmet which he had to wear for long periods of time. His most distinguishing features, however, were his dark piercing green eyes and full beard that reached the base of his neck.

Some recruits were fairly surprised when he suddenly smiled and greeted them all in a loud thundering voice. "Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, to the Hall Of Fire! It is here that we first separate the citizens from the soldiers, the Boros from the common people of this city! You are here today to compete for the honor and privilege of being recruited into the most powerful fighting force in all of Ravnica! While those eggheads at the Azorious Senate waste the day filing tomes and spilling ink you will be out in the field spilling blood! You will be in charge of keeping the peace, brothers and sisters, by ANY MEANS NECESSARY!"

The crowd of hopeful inductees roared with cheers as the commander then unsheathed his sword, which was just as weathered and battle scarred as he was, and thrust it high over his head. "Long live the Boros Legion!" he finished as many of the people around you started applauding and shouting. The commander smiled again as he sheathed his blade and brought forth a large brass box with a small hole in the top.

"We will begin by drawing lots. The test will be one on one, single combat. When your number gets called step forth to meet your opponent. Winner of the fight advances, losers go home. If you kill your opponent you forfeit the match and will be disqualified until the next recruitment meeting, so play nice. Let's get moving boys and girls!" With that the first few people lined up to draw their number.

You take a deep breath when your turn comes up and pull a folded sheet of parchment from the box. "Looks like I got lucky number 13. Great." you think to yourself as everyone gathers around to watch the first fight. "Numbers 1 and 2!" the commander calls as two men in armor step up. The fight lasts barely a minute before one of them is on the ground begging for mercy as they clutch a slashed leg. The rest of the fights proceed rapidly until about an hour later when you finally get called on to battle.

"Numbers 13 and 14, let's go!" the commander shouts as the last two fighters clear the area. Your opponent is...
11221.title: Battle Lottery

choices: Wait for a chance to dodge and perform a counterstrike
Fight defensively to observe her moves
112211.content:
"Ha, good luck to ya lov, you're gonna need it." comes a taunt from the crowd behind you as you step up for your match. A few seconds later the source of the voice walks out between a parted group of soldiers. The tall muscular woman now standing opposite from you had long red hair and a deep looking scar on her left cheek. In her hands was a massive iron battleaxe tightly clenched by brown leather gloves with studded iron knuckles. Her eyes were a deep light blue, but just as fierce as those of the Boros commander.

"May the best warrior win." she says as she pulls a chewed toothpick from her mouth and tosses it aside. You grip your warhammer tightly as the Boros commander walks a bit closer to better oversee the match. "Fight or bleed well!" you reply as you take a few steps closer to get into position. The woman merely smiles as she takes up a battle stance.

"Are you both ready?" the Boros commander asks as he raises a hand in the air. You and your opponent both nod and in an instant the commander has drawn his sword and raises it high above his head. "Match number seven has begun! Unleash hell!" he yells as a fresh round of cheers erupt from the crowd. Without a word you and the red-haired woman charge forward to begin the battle...
112211.title: The First Fight

choices: The woman uses a spell to heal herself
The woman abandons her battleaxe for martial arts
The woman uses an unexpected ability
1122112.content:
You hop to the side at the last second as the woman swings her battleaxe with enough force to embed it in the floor and close in to attack when she pulls it free and swings it again. "Oh damn!" you shout in surprise as you lean back to avoid catching the blade of the weapon on your left shoulder.

"I may be big, but I'm also fast lov." the woman smirks as she lifts the mighty battleaxe over her shoulders while you retreat a few steps to a safer distance. "Clearly, she means business." you whisper to yourself as you tighten your grip on your hammer. "I'll have to be quicker."

The woman charges once again and you rush up to meet her next attack head on. This time you time your attack for right after she swings and lunge forward to pass by the blade as it strikes the ground behind you. "Shoot!" the woman yells in surprise as you bring the full force of the warhammer into her torso and send her flying backwards onto the floor.

She lands with a thud and drops her battleaxe with a groan of pain. "Uh oh..." you think to yourself as the woman clutches her stomach. "I hadn't intended for her to take the full brunt of the attack like that...what if I delivered a fatal wound?" The Boros commander steps over to check the woman's vital signs and is visibly shocked as her eyes suddenly pop back open.

"Owww! Good hit, that one!" she shouts cheerfully as she stands back up with the support of her battleaxe. "The match will resume!" the Boros commander decrees to the shocked gasps and whispers of the crowd. You breathe a small sigh of relief that the woman didn't die and give her a smile.

"I'm glad to see you survived my attack." you call out to her. "But that hit must have at least broken some bones and torn some muscles. Surrender the match to me before you get hurt." The woman merely returns a smile and lets out a few chuckles. "I don't think so. I still intend to win this." she replies cheerfully.

You are surprised to hear she still plans to fight, but you want to win as well...
1122112.title: Close Calls

choices: Stay defensive until you get another chance to strike
11221121.content:
All of a sudden the woman coughs and a thin trickle of blood begins sliding down her lip as she slams down her battleaxe for support. "Ha, I knew I hit you harder than that." you say confidently as she wipes her mouth. "You fought well, if you give up now you can still try again at the next recruitment."

The woman chuckles softly as she coughs up a few fresh droplets of blood into her hand. "I already told ya lov, I'm stubborner than that. Besides, I've still got plenty of fight left in me." You let out a sigh as you prepare your next attack and the woman holds her hand over her lower chest. You then pause as she begins whispering something.

A few glimmers of light pour out over her body as she takes a few deep breaths. In an instant a flash of light passes over her hand and she stands up straight with a big grin on her face. "Didn't think I'd be needin' to break out the clerical stuff so soon. Your attack busted two of my lower ribs, punctured a lung and even gave me some internal bleeding. I may not be at 100% anymore but I know enough about white magic to finish this match."

You frowned as you gripped your own weapon tighter. Having an opponent who could heal was bad enough, let along one as strong and fast as she was. If you didn't do something soon she could easily wear you down to the point you collapse from a combination of wounds and exhaustion.

"Ready for the next round, then?" the woman calls as she twirls her battleaxe and levels it at you. "Bring it!" you call back as you both begin your charge.
11221121.title: Back In The Fight

choices: Run 4 miles in 36 minutes while holding your spear the whole time.
Do 20 pushups with your spear on you're back.
Take down a fast moving, nimble foe with your spear.
1123.content:
As you go to pick up the spear, it takes a surprising amount of strength takes to pick up a simple stick with a knife at the end of it. It must have been over 50 pounds you think to yourself, with all the strain you're putting into holding this weapon.
looking closer at it, the name Moral Rebuke was on it, with a string of fancy words following. "Who so ever wields this assegai will be carrying everyone of their immortal thoughts ever thought of." Clearly this enchanted weapon must be apart of the test.
*creak*
In an a voice of an enthusiastic late 20s man coming you from across. "Hurry up lad, you need to pass this one last test before I can ship you off to Basic Boros Training." Came my recruiter, Sergeant Thigpin, an athletic man in light red, white, brown armor.
"Now remember, after you pass this next task, you'll be shipped off to fort lost in the ruins, and trained to be a valued solider in the boros guild. You'll pass right?"
Looking to him with a fire interested your eye, you exclaim yes, you'll do what it takes to pass.
"Good you're next task is ____________. Now fallow me."
1123.title: A long tactical spear

choices: Ask if she has other work you can do instead
Ask her about your possible advancement
113.content:
You get out of bed in your tiny room and put on your official Orzhov attire which consisted of little more than undergarments and a black and white sash bearing their symbol. You had been an initiate for a week now and were a servant, which was barely a step up from being a slave. The only real difference, in fact, was that you could advance in rank and didn't have to be tattooed with the guild crest. Aside from that everything was the same right down to the menial labor and air of disrespect by more senior members.

Still, you were getting closer to advancement by the day and even recently got approval to learn basic mana control by your boss. You had potential for sure, you just needed to impress your superiors enough that they would let you further study magic and improve your skills. "Soon." you whispered to yourself as you stepped into the main hall of the cathedral to begin your work. "Very soon..."

Today your boss was a young woman barely two ranks above you who had just recently gotten her position due to one of her superiors getting fatally stabbed while out collecting debts. She was kind enough for someone who belonged to this particular guild, though she expected hard work and total obedience from her underlings. "Hello." you say warmly as you walk up to her and wave your hand. "Good morning servant." she replies as she pulls a small white chest from a shelf and hands it to you. "Fill that up with today's coin offerings and put it in vault five on the second floor then come back here for your next assignment."
113.title: Masters And Slaves

choices: Head back and get your next assignment
Have a quick peek around the vault
1131.content:
For the next few hours you walk around the massive public halls and ceremony rooms collecting the stray silver and gold coins left by patrons in alters, fountains and collection plates. Most of the currency was stamped with the Orzhov mark, but every now and then a few global coins appeared mixed into the tiny piles as well. Everyone knew that the Orzhov coins were worth twice as much as normal money... though they could only be spent at official guild locations and businesses.

The white chest in your hands grew heavier every minute until you were forced to sit it down as you retrieved the last of the offerings from the dangling sky alters affixed to the roof of the cathedral. The loot left in these places tended to be almost nothing as only flying or levitating visitors could leave coins in them, but today had a decent haul and you knew that missing even a single silver piece would delay your promotion by another week at the least.

When you were finally done you headed past a trio of ghostly aristocrats to the vault as instructed and stored the days bounty inside. You had a bit of sweat running down your forehead from the work, yet didn't feel quite as tired as you had the previous few days. Hopefully, your efforts would pay off before you got too use to so much exercise.
1131.title: Coin Collector

choices: Head straight to the Boros forge
Stop by a tavern for a quick drink
Visit with a friend until the rain passes
11311.content:
You immediately head back to your boss to get your next assignment, the day was still young and you weren't ready to give up hope that a promotion waited at the end of it. "Ah, there you are. Excellent." the young woman says as she turns to face you. "I was just talking to my superiors and we decided that you are ready for advancement." She then pulls out an order form as you walk up to greet her.

"Thank you very much ma'am." you reply as she hands you the parchment along with a sack of coins. "We just put in an order for gold ingots from a Boros owned forge, you just need to deliver the last payment and make sure the delivery boy has the right address. Try to make it back before sundown and we can get you fitted for your new robes. The price was already agreed upon, so don't let them try to talk you down either. Just give them the money and come back."

"I'll return shortly." you say as you head back to your room to change into your street clothes. After securing the payment for the delivery in a leather knapsack you head out into the busy morning streets. All around you the citizens of Ravnica were heading off to work or shopping at various markets and bazaars. Your local guild leader had made a wise choice in setting up his branch of the Orzhov so close to the business district. More coin for the coffers and more debt to collect payment on.

Overhead the sky was starting to get cloudy with only a few thin rays of light shinning down through them. In a few minutes it would likely start raining.
11311.title: Gold Rush

choices: Try to force your way inside
113111.content:
You quickened your pace as light droplets of water began sprinkling down from the heavens. All you had on was a simple tunic with no hood, if you weren't quick about getting to your destination you'd likely get soaked. "Hey! Watch it!" a grumpy goblin calls out as you shove past him and take a quick turn down a street that led to a shortcut. A few more people shouted or cursed as you then brushed your way past them down a narrow passage between two large buildings.

You were now in Boros turf, which was obvious from the many red and white flags and banners hanging from nearby windows and spires. This part of the city was a bit odd compared to the rest, with tons of towering forges and fortresses eclipsing the relatively flat neighborhood and market districts. One minute you would be in the shade of a colossal building and the next you could see the distant horizon over the rows of short rooftops and chimneys.

The rain started picking up by the time the actual forge listed on the address came into view so you ran the last few steps of the way around a bakery and quickly climbed up the steps leading to the front door. You were about to head inside when one of the two Boros guards stationed there held up her hand and blocked your way. "I'm sorry sir, but we are closing early today. We just got an order for a massive shipment and we can't afford to waste time on anything else." she said sternly as her partner tightened his grip on his spear.

"But I have an import order from the Orzhov!" you protest as you retrieve the order form. "We bought a large quantity of high quality gold that we have one last payment on. If I don't finalize everything today our gold might not arrive on time. Please, I just need five minutes."

The guard simply shakes her head. "I'm afraid not, you'll have to deliver that payment tomorrow...or whenever we decide to re-open." she replies as she hands you back the order form. You open your mouth to argue but the guards shoot you a glare that tells you they don't feel like talking anymore...
113111.title: Downpour

choices: Climb up to one of the inner windows for a better view
1131113.content:
You turn away from the guards and head back down the slippery steps as the pouring rain soaks through your clothes. You are annoyed by their refusal to serve you and your guild, but if an agent of the Orzhov was anything, it was resourceful. You turn to leave the front of the building and take a few moments to look around and make sure no one sees you slip around the corner down a street than ran alongside the massive forge.

Luckily, most people were inside next to warm fires and hot meals...this little storm may just have been a blessing in disguise. You smirk as you step down a tiny alley and look up at the towering Boros building standing before you. "The fools don't even have windows on the lower floors." you say smugly as you begin channeling some white mana from the area around you. You had a vial of black mana that you had brought with you as well, but wanted to save it for an emergency as Boros territory contained very little of the stuff.

You laugh as tiny translucent crystal wings begin to form on your ankles in a rainbow hue of colors. "I may not know many spells yet, but I've paid enough attention to know how to give myself a little boost." you say as you make a quick leap off of the wall of the forge and land on the rooftop of a tall house. One you get a better look at the structure of the forge you plan a route and hop into action.

Most of the walls around you were flat and smooth but a few alcoves and thin platforms provided you all the solid footing you would need. In just a few minutes you were standing beneath an iron window with a large glass panel latched over it. Upon making sure the coast was clear you pop open the latch and climb down inside.

You appeared to be inside a massive hallway leading around the upper floors of the forge in a loop. To your left was a stairway leading higher up and to your left was a stairway leading down. The only decorations were several large inner windows outlining the Boros logo that provided a view of the forges below, which were aglow with molten metals being poured and shaped.

"Hopefully this won't take too long." you say as the crystals on your feet crumble to dust.
1131113.title: Ascension

choices: Confront whoever is coming directly and try talking to them
Hide in one of the rooms
11311131.content:
Wasting no time you dart up the stairs towards the upper level. "If the forges are below it would make sense that they store all of their goods and materials on the top somewhere." you whisper to yourself quietly as you turn and head up a new set of stairs that take you to the next floor.

In front of you was a vast hallway that looped around the far corner in one direction. There were no large windows to peek through here, but there were a few sturdy doors lining the inner wall. The place also had a few more decorations, such as hanging banners and a few fancy carvings running along the walls. It was nice, though you had little time to appreciate the craftsmanship while you hurried along. Orzhov architecture was better anyway.

You check the small plaques next to each of the doors for clues, but they were just numbered and didn't offer any information on what was actually inside. "Guess I'll have to press my luck and try each one, hope I don't stumble into an office or something." you chuckle as you stand back to look over each of the doors.

Unfortunately, before you can decide on which to open first footsteps echo down the distant hall from around the corner. "Uh oh, looks like I've got company coming." you mutter as you take out the vial of black mana and run your fingers over the surface. "I was hoping to save this...which probably won't be happening if I get into a fight now. What should I do...?" The footsteps draw closer as you decide on a plan of action.
11311131.title: Moving On Up

114.content:
You grinned as you sat down at a table in the far corner of a private library next to a single dimly lit torch. Across from you was a young woman in a blue hood casually playing with a knife as she scratched a few notes on a torn piece of parchment. "Were you followed?" she asked suddenly as she stopped writing and put the knife down to give you her full attention. "No ma'am. No one saw me come here." you replied confidently with a sly smile.

"Almost, at least." a third voice echoed as a man in a black cloak strolled into the room and stopped in front of your table. Your first instinct was to draw your own knife, but you managed to keep your cool and decide to see how this plays out. "So, how did our friend here do?" asked the woman as she leaned back in her chair and balanced her knife with a finger. "Not bad actually, he almost gave me the slip twice... if not for my tracking spell he would have lost me at the bell tower a few streets back." the man replied with a mildly impressed tone.

The woman nodded her head and looked back at you with a smirk. "You were not stealthy enough to make it here unnoticed, but you certainly have potential if you almost managed to elude one of our best scouts. We here at House Dimir hate to see such potential go to waste so I will give you a new task. If you pass, you will be accepted as an acolyte in our guild. What do you say?" she asked in a sweet tone.
114.title: Shadows In The Night

choices: A large mansion surrounded by an iron fence
A towering bank made of stone and high quality metal
1141.content:
"Excellent. You have until the first light of dawn to complete this task." the woman says as she slides the piece of paper she was writing on over to you. "Good luck." You pick up the tiny piece of parchment and read it over. Apparently, there were three valuable treasures the Dimir had their eye on this month that you were to acquire inconspicuously. A ring, a necklace and an earring. Each belonged to a different rival guild member, although their addresses were all in the same area... an upper class residential district near the border between territories.

After reading over your assignment you look up to find the two Dimir agents gone without a trace. "I suppose any questions will have to wait..." you say as you head over to a window and undo the latch on it. You gently push the window open and look up at the moon...it was about five or six hours until dawn, maybe seven at the most. After making sure the window was secured behind you and locked you then jump from the ledge and soar down to a rooftop right below you.

A light gust of wind conjured by blue mana cushions and silences your impact and you are soon gone from sight. After nearly half an hour of navigating the shadows you come across a large church with beautiful stained glass windows. "Looks like I'm in Orzhov turf now, almost at the first mark." you whisper silently to yourself. You cross a few more streets and come to...
1141.title: Under The Moonlight

11411.content:
In front of a tall iron fence stood two guards dressed in knightly armor with golden face plates and engravings. "Heh, leave it to the Orzhov to focus on style over substance." you chuckle to yourself as you sneak around to the far edge of the fence and hop over it in a single leap.

Another guard on patrol turns around the corner and you quickly duck behind some tall bushes as he passes. You get ready to draw your knife when he pauses to inspect a broken twig and breathe a sigh of relief when he tosses it aside and moves on. After the guard makes another turn around the far corner of the mansion you dart from the tall bushes up to the front door.

The first thing you do is check a nearby window to make sure the inside is clear and quickly rust the inner lock with a bit of magic. With swift grace you pull the door open and silently close it all in the span of two seconds. The inner hall of the mansion was just as beautiful as you had expected with several expensive statues, vases and paintings decorating the room from top to bottom. There was even a massive rug draped over the floor with the Orzhov symbol proudly displayed for all to see.

"Alright, I'm in." you whisper to yourself as you take a quick look around. "Now I just need to find that ring..."
11411.title: The First Mark

114111.content:
You silently move up the large staircase leading to the second floor and duck just behind the railing as a guard walks over to inspect a locked door. While she is distracted making sure everything is still secure you carefully move past her into the hallway and crouch behind a long table decorated with flowers and antique candlesticks.

After a few moments the guard raises her hand and a small ball of light covers her outstretched palm. Once she has a quick look around she unlocks the door and steps inside, disappearing from sight. "Seems I'm not the only thief on the job tonight." you chuckle to yourself as you get up and move towards the far end of the hallway. "I just hope we aren't looking for the same prize, I'm already on the clock...last thing I need is a race."

You carefully unlock a secure white door covered in gold engravings and the Orzhov seal. "This should be the master bedchamber." you say softly as you peek through the keyhole to see if its clear. Surprisingly, not even the owner was inside...sleeping or otherwise. For all you knew, the guards were patrolling an empty house...very strange.

"I'd best hurry up before that guard decides to come checking in here." you say as you close the door behind you and lock it shut. "Now where should I start...?''
114111.title: Shrouded In Dark

choices: Take the ring and try to escape out the window
1141112.content:
You walk over to a large portrait of an older man dressed in expensive white and black robes and gold jewelry. "Don't know if this guy would be so dumb as to hide the ring in such an obvious place, but he doesn't seem to be the subtle type." you chuckle as you gently pull the painting off the wall and place it on the bed.

"Well now, what do we have here?" you say sarcastically as you pull out your knife and walk back over to the now exposed wall safe. The whole thing was solid white with plenty of gold trimmings, but no handles, buttons, switches, levers or dials to speak of. "Now how do I get this thing open?"

You take a seat on the bed and look at the large Orzhov symbol that took up half of the front side of the safe while thinking about your training dealing with magically locked containers. "Do I need one of their passwords or spells to get it open?" you wonder aloud as you take out your knife and begin fiddling with it.

You let out a puzzled gasp when you notice that the Orzhov symbol is a bit off...somehow. You rub your chin as you think back to the large rug you saw when you first came in. "It looks like a star of some kind... or the sun perhaps? Or maybe...the moon?" you whisper when the realization finally hits you. "Of course...I see it now!"

You walk over to the only window in the room and reflect a beam of moonlight from your blade onto the symbol. Suddenly, it begins to glow as a thin crescent shape on the inner circle of the Orzhov mark lights up. "I've got it!" you exclaim in delight as the safe clicks a few times and opens a small door just big enough to stick a teapot through. Inside the tiny chamber was a small ring on a miniature stand.

You are about to grab your prize when you hear footsteps coming from down the hall...one of the guards was coming back!
1141112.title: Nothing Evades My Sight

choices: Offer to tell her of a greater treasure in exchange for the ring
Offer her a partnership with you in exchange for a chance at more loot
Try to catch her off guard with a surprise attack
11411123.content:
You quickly grab the ring and run over to the window as the footsteps outside approach the door. You use your knife to get the lock open and are just about to push open the latch when the door to the room swings open. You freeze in place and hold out your knife as the mildly surprised female guard from earlier steps into the room and closes the door back.

You both stare at each other for a few moments without saying a word and you briefly consider pushing the window open and making a run for it. Of course, that would no doubt send out an alarm and make the rest of your night very unpleasant. No, you still had a chance to do this stealthily if you played your cards right and you fully intended to.

After several tense seconds of silence the woman steps forward and gives you a slight smile as she places a hand on her sheathed sword. "Hello there, thief. I see I wasn't the only one searching for a prize tonight..." she says without taking her eyes off the ring in your hand. "I don't suppose you would be so kind as to hand it over?"

You return her smile as you put the ring in your pocket. "Sorry, I got here first and I need this ring for some very important business. Perhaps you could find some other prize tonight?" The woman frowns and draws her sword. "I'm afraid not. Nothing else here is worth that ring. Now I'll tell you one last time... give it to me or your luck will take a sharp turn for the worse tonight."

You glance down at your knife and look at her sword. A direct fight would be hard enough without making noise... and more guards would blow this whole thing wide open. Seems you need to be very careful about your next course of action.
11411123.title: There Are No Clean Getaways...

choices: Head over and talk to the centaur woman
Take a nap to replinish your strength
Call the centaur woman over to you
115.content:
You gazed in awe at the view of the city below from behind a wooden railing high above the ground. You had entered The Hall Of New Life just a few hours ago and were already high enough in the massive tree tower that the buildings below looked like rows of large dominos just waiting to tip over. It was hard to believe nature could create something so vast and impressive, but that was the main reason you had decided to come here.

After years as just another guildless resident of Ravnica you had finally decided to try your luck with the Selesnya Conclave. After admiring the scenery for a few more minutes you headed up yet another flight of stairs and were relieved to see a lobby area of sorts filled with benches. Immediately, you took a seat next to a man in a white hood who was busy reading a tome with a large tree symbol on the front.

"Excuse me sir, but do you know where I can register to become a member of this guild?" you ask as you stretch out your feet a bit. The man doesn't speak right away and finishes the paragraph he is on before lowing the book and turning to face you. "You a new initiate?" he asks as he places the book back in his satchel and stands up to leave. "Yes, I'm here to apply, but its been a hassle just trying to navigate this place." The man grins and points you to a centaur woman talking to a large man in knightly armor over near the entrance to the center of the tower. You thank him as he walks off and sit back in your seat for a few more minutes of rest before you get up.
115.title: All For One And One For All

choices: Skim over the important rules and return to her
Take the time to study and memorize everything
1151.content:
After catching your breath you head over to the centaur woman, who gives you a kind smiles as the knight heads off down a nearby hall. "Hello citizen, I take it you are here to learn about the Selesnya Conclave?" she asks politely as she takes a quill and piece of parchment out of a bag on her back. "Yes, in fact I want to join you." you reply as she begins writing something down.

"Oh good, we can always use new members." she replies without looking up. "We here at the Conclave accept all comers regardless of race, temperament or gender. All we ask is that you follow the rules and principles we live and die by and that you put Selesnya above all else. I realize this a big commitment, do you need some time to think this over?"

You shake your head and fold your arms. "No thank you, I knew before I even came here that this was the guild for me. Besides, I already climbed up the stairs to get here." you reply as she takes a small tome out of her bag and hands it to you along with a small scroll. "Welcome new brother." she says excitedly as you take the items she hands you. "Here is a book outlining all of our official rules and customs as well as a scroll containing your initiate pledge. Read both carefully and return to me when you are ready."

You thank her and head back to the bench to read over the material she has given you.
1151.title: New Arrival

choices: Take a seat near the front and rest for a minute
11513.content:
The cool breeze of the evening air swept through the halls as the light began to fade from the sky. You were tired from all the walking and reading you had done the previous day, but knew it would all be worth it to show your devotion to your new family. After all, you only get to make one first impression, might as well make it a good one. You yawn as you close the scroll and attempt to recite the initiate pledge from memory.

A faint smile appeared on your lips as you opened the scroll to find that you had read every single word flawlessly. Now that you knew all of the rules and were ready to take the pledge all you had to do was find the centaur woman from before and prove your devotion to the Selesnya. Unfortunately, she seems to have slipped away on other business while you were diligently studying your vows. Looks like your work isn't done quite yet.

You let out a sigh and get up from the bench. You wanted nothing more than to get a good rest, but it seemed fate had something else in store for you this night. "I can't just leave and risk forgetting something, I need to apply now while the words are still fresh in my mind." you whisper sleepily as you rub your eyes. You take a quick walk around the area to see if the centaur woman or one of her associates were nearby. The only people left on this floor were a thin elf man visiting on behalf of the Simic and his assistant, some sort of frog lizard man thing that didn't speak to you.

You rub your forehead and head for the stairs leading to the above floors. You weren't sure exactly how high nonmembers were allowed to go, so you kept a close eye out for any sort of security personnel. After ascending three floors you came to a large church-like room with a beautiful Selesnya symbol formed in tree branches overlooking a row of pews and a small stage of sorts. There was a single other visitor at this late hour, a young woman in a white and green tunic...
11513.title: Late Hours

12.content: Good, now choose a guild.
12.title: For Order!

choices: Check the back alleys for illegal conduct
Question nearby citizens for suspicious activity
121.content:
You get out of bed and stretch your arms as the sun begins peeking into the window of your new apartment. A week ago today you had been accepted as an acolyte of the Azorious Senate and had spent most of your time since moving into your new home and getting ready to begin your new job. It was still early, but you didn't want to be late on your first day so you quickly ate breakfast and got dressed in your brand new blue robes with white highlights.

After making sure you had everything you needed you stepped outside into the light mist sweeping around the buildings. The city was much more quiet during these times, but you knew that life in Ravnica was anything except mundane... even on its slowest days. You had been instructed to take the long way around to your new outpost to inspect a neighborhood known for a recent outbreak of minor criminal activity.

It wasn't supposed to be dangerous or anything, just a brief warm-up task to get you ready to serve the guild with devotion and integrity. The most you expected to find were a few gamblers, crooked street vendors or maybe a gang of mischievous goblin punks harassing the locals. Still, this wasn't how you had hoped your first day would go...
121.title: Lawmakers And Lawbreakers

choices: Wait for the crowds to grow bigger
Find a way to make yourself more inconspicuous
Head to work without any new leads or information
1211.content:
You head to the local marketplace and begin silently walking past the stalls as a small crowd of people begins to form in the early hours of this foggy morning. You had hoped more people would be up and about by now to help mask you from the eyes of the merchants. Your robes were a dead giveaway to any lawbreaker who spotted them and any skilled trader knew how to hide the illegal stuff from any prying eyes or slippery tongues. If you were to get anything done today you'd have to avoid drawing attention to yourself.

After taking a quick look around the market you head over to a small bench on the corner and take a moment to rest your feet. Your gut told you that something was off about this place, but it would be impossible to find out anything with everyone having their guard up around you. "If I stay much longer I might be late for work, but unless more people show up I won't be able to blend in with the crowd." you say as you think over your options. Eventually you decide to...
1211.title: Shops And Suspicions

12111.content:
You waited another half an hour for more people to come out, reasoning that arriving late to work was better than arriving empty-handed. You make sure no one notices as you slip into a group of large men heading towards one of the meat stands. Their size and girth helps keep you from the weary eyes of the merchants and it isn't long before you begin picking up a few secrets from the vendors as you pass them.

Apparently, this innocent little market square was the hotbed of crime in the area with all sorts of deals going down even in broad daylight. You break away from the group of men as they purchase their breakfast and walk with a group of upper class ladies as they stroll down a row of stands offering jewelry and flowers. You hear a few more juicy tidbits as you cross the street to the local bakery and stand back as the women all disappear inside.

In just five minutes you picked up on a black market bazaar that was going to be held in a secret location, an illegal exchange of sensitive guild information and even a tip off about an underground gambling house hidden in a local inn. Not to mention all of the codes and standards violations from shopkeepers cutting corners on their products.

You had a lot to go on, but it still wasn't quite enough to shut down any of these criminal operations. Unfortunately, you would have to leave soon if you hoped to avoid being extremely late, which wouldn't look at all good on your record. With a sigh you decide to go after...
12111.title: Faceless In The Crowd

choices: Take a heavy mace and shield
122.content:
You brought the steel sword down on the training dummy with such force that splinters flew off as the blow connected. "Excellent work, new blood. Keep practicing, the commander will be arriving soon to pick out new recruits. Good luck." a man in shining knight armor said gruffly as he passed by you on his way to the main hall. "Thank you, sir! I'll do my best." you hastily reply as you take another swing at the dummy.

After a few more minutes a woman in impressive platinum armor with tightly woven red clothing underneath stepped forward from the main hall and looked around the room. She had a large scar running across the bridge of her nose and short blonde hair, but was very beautiful in the soft glow of the fires in the training room. "Welcome, new initiates! Today is the last time we will be selecting new soldiers until next month, so be sure to impress me if you plan on advancing anytime soon." she bellowed loudly so that even the far corners of the room could hear.

"Before we can allow you to fight for us we need to know what you can do." the commander continued as guards brought in a small armory's worth of equipment. "We have bows and arrows, spears, axes, swords, shields, maces, big wooden sticks and more. Show me what you can do with what we've provided and just maybe I'll let you advance today. You have one hour!" With that, she stepped down and began circling the room as hopeful initiates rushed to grab a weapon...
122.title: Pax Per Bellum

choices: Try to harness the magical power of your swords
1221.content:
You picked up a pair of iron short swords off of the wooden rack and began looking them over as you moved out of the way for the next guy to grab his weapon. The hilt of both swords were wrapped tightly in leather and softly glowing runes appeared whenever you gave the blade a light swing. Most importantly, a small Boros guild symbol was masterfully etched into the tips of both blades.

You smiled as you practiced swinging the swords a few times to get used to them and watched as the runes flared up brighter and brighter with each powerful swing. Clearly, both of these blades were enchanted by some sort of magic that you could harness if you figured out how it worked. You had mastered basic training and techniques like the other guild aspirants, but knowledge of spells and the mystic arts would give you a clear advantage over the competition.

You looked around the room at the others as they tried to show off with fancy fighting styles and acrobatic movements. Some people were striking down dummies, some were trying to wield weapons that they clearly had no idea about and a few were evening battling each other. "Ten more minutes til we call it quits!" the Boros commander shouted as she headed towards the center of the room. If you were going to impress her, now was the time...
1221.title: The Blades Of Boros Burn Hot

123.content:
You were an up and coming enforcer for the Orzhov. While you were perhaps not the toughest or most intimidating enforcer, you could make up for it with your feminine wiles and skill with knives. Also, you had a secret weapon: you could use mana, quite well, in fact.

Whether it was white healing spells for when your debtors got rowdy and set you on fire, or painful black spells for punishing late payments, you were feared by any debtors who crossed your path. One day, you were out collecting a payment from a man named Skizzum McSkuzz. That was the day things changed, big time.

You knocked on the door of Skizzum McSkuzz's apartment.
"Open up, McSkuzz! You owe fifty gold, and I'm here to make sure you pay what's due!" you screamed. Really, McSkuzz only owed thirty-five gold, but you wanted to keep a cut for yourself so you could maybe hit the taverns and the gambling hall after work.
"No one's home!" A loud, gravelly voice called back.
"Well if no one's home, then who are you?" you asked.
"No One, that's who! Now go away!" The voice bellowed.
You put your face in your palm.
"I don't have time for this..." you say to yourself.
123.title: Orzhov Syndicate: Female

choices: You beat up McSkuzz some more
You report back to your boss
You hit the bars and gambling halls
1231.content:
You kick down the door and brandish your long, curved knife. On the other side of the door was a fat, tall goblin, Skizzum McSkuzz.
"Pay up, McSkuzz!" You shouted.
McSkuzz clenched his fist. "I ain't afraid o' you!" He called back.
McSkuzz rocketed his arm forward, straight for your face. You rolled to the side as McSkuzz's punch shattered a nearby end table to splinters. McSkuzz wound up for another punch, but you had already rolled between the giant goblin's legs. You jumped up to wrap your arms around McSkuzz's neck and brought him to the ground like a bulldog. You then took your knife and brought it dangerously close to the crotch of McSkuzz's pants.

"Now, Skizzum, I can take your coin purse, or I can take your COIN PURSE. Which'll it be?" you say.
"I don't know what youse talkin' about!" Skizzum said.
You couldn't believe how dumb this guy was.
"You wanna be eunuch?" You growl.
"No! NO! Antthing but that!" Skizzum begged.
"Then pay up that fifty gold!" You say.
"I thought I only owed thirry-five..." Skizzum said.
"Well, you owe interest now. Pay up!" You say, moving your knife ever closer to Skizzum's crotch. The tip of it now pierced the fabric of his pants, although it hadn't touched Skizzum's flesh yet.
"I gots some money under the sink! use that!" Skizzum said.
You released McSkuzz from your hold and cast a binding spell to hold him down for a moment. Chains of white mana held him down.
"This better not be a trap, bub." You say.
You opened up the drawer under the sink and found a soggy, filthy sack. Inside was a small pile of gold. You quickly counted it and found more than sixty gold in there, well over how much you were asking for. You gleefully take it all.
"Thank you, Mr. McSkuzz. You're safe... for now." You say.

What happens next?
1231.title: Taking The Goblin's Coin Purse...

choices: Try to get more gold from the other players before beginning
Play fairly with just the two gold you have
Cheat using every trick in the book
12313.content:
You take seven coins from the money bag and put them into your own purse. "Sixty is more than enough to report back with. I'll take a bit of my payment in advance this week." you say to yourself with a sly smile. Normally, seven gold wouldn't last long at one of your local hangouts, but you had a few clever ways of multiplying it. In no time you were walking through the front door of a tiny little mead house sandwiched in between an ale warehouse and a library on the street leading to the local guild hall. The place was cozy, only about ten feet to the side walls, but it served some of the best drink in the entire Orzhov territory.

After dropping five gold on a bottle of wine you headed over to a gambling table where a vashino lizard man and a girl in dark brown robes were playing a game with small stone pieces and an abacus while a glum-looking man with a beard watched. "Go broke already, Veni?" you ask as the woman in the robes scoots over to give you a seat. The man gives you a sour look and crosses his arms. "Damn lizard cheated..." he muttered under his breath. "Nobody wins that many rounds in a row.."

The lizard man looks up as he places a few gold coins next to one of his pieces and takes a tally on the abacus. "Ignore the man, wouldn't be the first time I've had to deal with a sore loser." he says confidently as the woman in the robes moves two of her pieces and puts five gold next to one of them. "Wanna join the next round?" she asks as you uncork the bottle of wine and begin pouring everyone some. "Maybe, I only got two gold to spare... so it wouldn't take long..." you say innocently as you pull out your coin purse and place the two gold onto the table.
12313.title: You in?

123133.content:
You were usually pretty skilled at this game, but skill mattered very little when all you had were two gold pieces to your name. Luckily, you knew dozens of ways to cheat without drawing attention to yourself so long as you played carefully and patiently. "All right, I'll wager both my gold on my next move." you say as you tally the amount on your abacus and move the gold pieces.

The lizard man suppressed a chuckle as he moved ten of his own gold while the girl in the robes moved six. You move one of your pieces and grin as the lizard man stares in shock as the nearly impossible move you just pulled off. "Looks like I win thirteen gold and Jiya here gets to keep three of her six. That puts me at fifteen gold now, nice." you say, feigning slight surprise.

"Beginners luck." The vashino grumbles as he takes a fresh stack of gold from his bag and puts it on the table. "I've still got way more skill and enough gold to command the next round easily." You merely grin as you move ten of your recently won coins and put them next to one of your stone pieces. "Don't be so sure, Veni and Jiya may not be up to your skill level, but I've got more than enough experience to take you." you say as you tally up the new amount on the abacus.

"Great." Veni mumbles as he takes a sip from his drink. "Yeah, thanks for the compliment." Jiya adds sarcastically as she makes her next play. "Relax guys, I'm just teasing." you reply as the lizard man makes his move. "Now the real fun begins." he taunts as he puts a dozen gold next to one of his pieces.
123133.title: Queen Of Games

choices: Trick him into giving you the money
1232.content:
You let out a sigh and try to remain patient. While most of your clients weren't exactly scholars you had forgotten just how stubborn and stupid goblins could get and how much of a pain it was to deal with them. "Look, McSkuzz, we already know where you live, who your friends are and where you hang out at." you say loudly as you rest a hand on the door. "You're lucky they sent me and not some thrall or mercenary knight, but that will change if you don't pay your due and give us what you owe. I just want the money and I'll leave you alone... the next thing that knocks on this door today won't be so kind."

After a few seconds of silence the annoyed goblin opens the door and lets you inside his rancid home. It wasn't exactly a nice place to live, but if Skuzz had the cash for somewhere fancy he wouldn't be borrowing money from you all the time. "Look, it... uh, got lost. Yeah! I can't pay you now with only twenty gold pieces... I need more time..." the little goblin man stalls as he backs up against a wall. "Come back later! Tomorrow!"

You let out another sigh, it was going to be one of those days...
1232.title: Debt Collector

choices: Explore the grounds around the temple
124.content:
A light drizzle began to fall as you carefully navigated the slender stone alleys on your way to the meeting place. It wasn't very cold out, but you kept a thick blue cloth wrapped around your nose, mouth and neck to hide your identity. It was fortunate that you were passing through a particularly seedy part of town, otherwise you might look a tab suspicious. You still didn't know why the meet up had to be scheduled for the early afternoon instead of at night, though you did know better than to question your superiors, especially after they were gracious enough to give you an invite into their guild.

For most people it was hard to be accepted by their chosen guild and required many hours of hard work and labor, though with enough determination almost anyone could join up sooner or later if they had a little talent and patience. Not so with the elusive Dimir guild, of which barely anyone knew anything about. Most people never even notice when a Dimir agent passes by them on the street and getting invited into this exclusive club of rouges was an honor by itself.

You made a sharp turn and passed by an old inn that had been collapsed by a Gruul raid a few weeks back and then headed straight for an old temple on the edge of the outskirts of the wildlands where nature still had a reasonably strong hold of the land over the city. "I'm getting dangerously close to rival territory." you thought to yourself as you clutched the small dagger affixed to your belt. Hopefully, the Dimir contact wouldn't keep you waiting too long...
124.title: A Walk To The Park

1242.content:
You step under a crumbling archway to get out of the rain and survey the terrain around you. As ruined as this old temple was it was nothing compared to the surrounding buildings, most of which had been partially or totally collapsed by Gruul raids and expeditions. You could probably handle a small Gruul war party or a single giant thug if they happened upon you, but with little more than a dagger and cloak you didn't feel it was wise to press your odds.

After nearly ten minutes a hooded figure dropped down behind you and held a tiny blade to your throat. "Slash slash... you're dead." he joked cheerily as you turned around and he withdrew his weapon. He was a tall man, much taller than you had expected and was at least seven or maybe even eight feet tall. His long white hair flowed freely and his skin was nearly as dark as his cloak. Around his neck was a simple silver necklace and on his left index finger was a silver ring bearing the Dimir symbol.

He gives you a smile as he puts his little knife away.
1242.title: A Friendly Arrival

choices: Rent a Pegasus to fly you up
Hire a mage to transport you there
Buy an artifact that allows you to reach the hall
125.content:
You carefully brush past a large centaur in silver armor as you hurry down the main road leading to The Hall Of New Life. In the past weeks you had applied to join the Selesnya Conclave and finally received notice of your acceptance just yesterday. The guild had asked that you only bring the bare essentials with you to the hall as it would be your new home from now on, which was fine with you as you didn't have much to your name at the moment.

As the twisting alleys and stony streets began to slowly give way to lush fields of grass and towering trees you knew that you were getting close. As the last of the tall buildings passed behind you the sight of The Hall Of New Life finally came into view in the air up ahead. You let out a soft gasp as you focused your gaze on the floating wonder, which seemed to take up half of the sky in front of you. Honestly, it was hard to tell what you were more impressed with, the sheer size of the tree itself... or how the surrounding buildings and structures so perfectly entwined with it.

A group of goblins passed by as you began climbing up the polished white steps leading towards the main hub of the Selesnya. Dozens of thoughts raced in your mind as you came upon an open market sort of area surrounded by tall pillars and archways. All around you various merchants and shopkeepers offered different ways to travel up to the main hall, each more fantastic than the last.

What do you plan on using to reach your guild?
125.title: Going Up?

choices: Ask if you could skip the tour and head straight to your destination
Ask if you could fly around a bit more before heading to your destination
Patiently wait until you reach your stop
1252.content:
You walk over to a short man in blue robes who was channeling glowing blue mist in front of a small crowd of onlookers. He gives you a sly wink when he notices you approach and forms the mist into a tiny glowing translucent ball that softly radiated mana. "If you're heading up to see the Selesnya or just want a sky tour of their little clubhouse I can grant you safe and memorable passage for only twenty coins. Who wants to take part in the trip of a lifetime?"

A few of the people gathered around begin whispering to one another as you step forward and hold up a shiny new coin. "I'll take passage to The Hall Of New Life please." you say with a grin. "I'm eager to see what kind of transport you have in store for us." The man lets out a hearty laugh as you dig out 19 other coins to pay him with. "I assure you all, this is money well spent. Anyone else up for a ride?"

You hand over the money and then head up to the platform the old man points you to while he collects the fee from a few other passengers. After a few minutes he heads over with four other people (a tall vashino lizardman, two female elves and a skinny guy in a cleric robe) and joins you on the platform. "Everyone move close together, I don't want to waste more mana than I have to." he says as he charges up the blue mist he was using earlier.

With a wave of his hand a large cloud of pure blue mana encircles the small group and forms a clear glowing bubble. "This won't be a quick ride folks, but it will be fun!" he says excitedly as the bubble lifts off the ground and begins slowly soaring through the air. "Quite incredible." one of the two elves muses as the market area begins shrinking below you.

In another few minutes you were floating high above even the tallest buildings as your guide began talking of the history of the surrounding neighborhood.
1252.title: To The Sky

13.content: Good, now choose a guild.
13.title: For Freedom!

choices: Throw another fighter in the way
131.content:
You had been working out a lot these past few days so you could join the Gruul Clans. You were sick of being treated like an outcast and a simpleton all your life, so you wanted to join a guild full of outcasts and simpletons. You knew it would not be easy, though. To join the Gruul, you had to survive a fierce melee against all the other prospective members. Anyone who survived got to join.

You had been lifting heavy bags of flour to work out and eating protein shakes at the milk bar to bulk up for the fights. You also took to practicing your fighting skills with drunks and beggars at night who might be looking for a quick scrap. For an average Ravnican citizen, you were fairly brawny and tough.

Soon, initiation night came. You made your way to the wrecked castle the local Gruul called home. There gathered a motley assortment of humans, centaurs, beasts, ad all sorts of tough, angry creatures. The prospective initiates were all pushed into a ring lit by numerous torches as the established members looked on. You threw off your shirt. You knew the battle would begin soon.

A feral looking minotaur stepped in front of the crowd. He was the local clan's warchief because he was the biggest, toughest Gruul in the area.
"You all want be Gruul?" The minotaur smiled.
You and the others hooted enthusiastically.
"Yeah, this group got fighting spirit! You all fight. If you live, you are now Gruul! Fight!" The minotaur commanded. He got the fight started by sucker punching a rowdy centaur and then hanging back to watch the carnage unfold.

You, despite your newfound strength, were at a size disadvantage. You were just a mostly normal citizen, and here you had to deal with rampaging horse-men and even a couple of ogres. You would have to rely on your cunning and instincts, two essential qualities of a Gruul warrior, if you were to survive the onslaught.

A massive horned centaur charged straight toward you. With a daring leap, you vaulted onto the horse-man's back and grabbed him by the neck. The centaur bucked and thrashed like a texas bronco, but you held tight.
"Get off, whelp!" The centaur yelled. He reared up on his hind legs and smashed you against a wall. Stunned, you fell to the ground. The centaur came charging for you again.

What do you do?
131.title: Gruul Clans: Male

choices: Try to fight with the sword and shield
1312.content:
Thinking quickly you grab a nearby goblin with a crude stone axe and toss him at the centaurs head. The little green ball of rage immediately sunk his axe into the beasts thigh and was knocked aside as you made a quick dive behind a pair of wrestling ogres. The angry centaur scanned the battlefield for you, but a sharp blow from a club quickly distracted him with a new foe.

"That was a close one." you said to yourself as you punched another goblin who charged at you with a small spear and hopped over a large rock just in time to avoid getting slammed by a collapsing barbarian. The fight continued on for several minutes before the minotaur announced the beginning of the final round. Anyone who could survive the next 30 seconds was in.

"Alright, I can do this!" you yell as you pick up a discarded shield and broken broadsword. Unfortunately, just as you were about to step back into the middle of the fray the centaur from before knocked you against the hard side of a crumpling stone wall. "Once I kill you I'll be in!" he taunted as you quickly staggered back to your feet with a broken arm. There was no time to think... you had to act now or die!
1312.title: Between A Centaur And A Hard Place

choices: Dodge to the side and then leap in with a punch
Grab the centaur and attempt to overpower him
Strike the ground in front of you as the centaur draws close
13122.content:
You try to stab the charging centaur with the broken sword, but your injured arm barely allowed the blade to piece his flesh. With a soft grunt the centaur pulled the blade from his left front leg and tossed it aside. "I got you good, human!" he taunted with a laugh as he placed a hand over his bleeding wound and emitted a flash of light from it. Just like that his stab wound was gone.

"Mana...wait, that's it!" you whispered as the centaur geared up for his final charge. You didn't have too much experience with magic, but knew how the basic flow of mana worked. Without a word you raised your broken arm and tried to focus. For a split second the world went silent and you felt the soft heartbeat of nature. The trees, the grass, the dirt and even the rocks...you felt at one with the natural world.

The loud roar of a charging centaur snapped your out of your trance as you channeled what little green mana you could into your right hand. The bones snapped back into place and you felt your muscles expand as glowing veins of green light spread throughout your arm. You didn't have enough time or energy to use a proper spell, but simply infusing the potent magical force into your fist was easy enough.

With seconds left before the minotaur called the fight you braced for your final showdown with the centaur.
13122.title: Green Thumb...And Fingers And Hand!

choices: Push him off your shield with enough might to cause him to fall down no his side
A small explosion erupts out of you, causing the centaur to fall to the ground.
13123.content:
He charged up to you and knocking you down off your feet and onto the ground, causing your sword skid out of your hand a few feet away from you. Then he brings his hooves up to trample you to death in one blow. "DIE!" You bring your shield up with your one good arm, keeping his hooves from caving your head in, but you can't hold it for much longer.

This whole situation is causing a fire of rage to brew in you. This hoofed bastard can't seem to give you a chance to beat him to a bloody pulp. But unbeknownst to you, there a faint red aura building around you. And then a something breaks in you causing you to,
13123.title: Try using red mana

choices: Head straight to the market and get the supplies
Stop by a local tavern for a quick drink
Head to a gambling house and see how your luck is this evening
132.content:
You hammer the final iron stake into the ground and quickly make sure that the tent is secure enough to hold for the coming nights. You had just joined the Rakdos Cult mere hours before and didn't want to screw up your first assignment and make a bad first impression. The job was simple enough, help the local guild members set up a small street fair in time for the upcoming full moon and make sure plenty of people paid for the shows and events. "Tent number three is up!" you call out to a man in a black and red jester suit.

The man lets out a cackle and walks over to inspect your work. As a veteran member who had managed to last over a year in the service of Rakdos he was the one in charge of leading this particular endeavor. "Good work my boy, this is some solid craftsmanship!" he says with a hearty laugh as he chews on a slab of roasted meat. "Just needs some fresh blood and some streamers and it'll be ready for the main event!"

You smile as he hands you a scroll with a list of supplies on it and tells you to have them by midnight if you want to be approved as an apprentice in the Rakdos guild. "I won't fail you!" you yell eagerly as you run off down the street towards the market square in the shady part of the district. It was already getting late and the crowds were fairly small, but you still wanted to get done and return as soon as possible. Still, after so much work you'd kill to have a short break and enjoy yourself a bit before moving on to your next task...
132.title: Did I Mention The Cult Is A Cult?

choices: See what the big party is about
Visit one of your underworld contacts
1322.content:
You pull the hood on your deep crimson robes over your head and put on your black masquerade mask to make sure none of your fellow guild members caught you slacking on the job and take a quick turn into a seedier part of the district. The entire surrounding neighborhood was comprised solely of Rakdos territory, but conflicts with the Golgari and Gruul were common along the borders.

Even though both guilds were technically on your side as members of The Resistance there were no official laws or decrees that prevented anyone from encroaching on rival turf to expand the might of their own group. In fact, with the Gruul Clans currently leading the head of The Resistance it was actually somewhat expected for allied guilds to fight one another to bolster their strength. If anyone got soft or weak they would be of no use and deserved to get conqured by a stronger opponent.

You quickly pushed the politics of the local area out of your head as you came upon a small cobblestone building barely three stories tall with a large wooden sign shaped like a mug of ale hanging over the front door. This place had become something of a local hangout for you over the past few years while you began working towards becoming a member of the Rakdos as nearly everyone had a new bit of useful gossip or illegal wares to sell each time you stopped by.

"The good old Firetongue Mead Inn." you whisper to yourself as you climb up the small stone staircase to the door. "I hope this place never changes, regardless of which guild is in charge."

The sound of loud boasts and slurred arguments is the first thing to hit you as you step inside, quickly followed by the sight of rowdy bar patrons guzzling their drinks and a faint smell of strong refreshments being spilled and sloshed everywhere. Luckily, tonight most of the drunks were having a party on one side of the bar and leaving everyone else to their (often shady) business.

You quickly grab a round of spiced mead and head for a table in the far corner where you could take a few minutes to rest. After you finish your beverage you decide to...
1322.title: A Drink A Day Keeps The Bloodlust Away

choices: "Sure, get us some top shelf drinks."
"Thanks, but I need to be going before it gets too late."
13223.content:
