On your way in you had noticed an old friend sitting in the far corner by herself sipping from a glass of wine and decided to take some time to catch up. You leave some money on the table for the bartender to pick up and walk over to greet her. She was actually with the Simic at the moment, but in a noncombat role so you didn't have to worry about any disagreements between your two guilds, thankfully.

"Hello Foxglove, mind if I have a glass of wine?" you say as you take a seat opposite from her. She ran a hand through her long white hair and gave you a glare. "And just who the hell are you?" she said sternly as she put aside the tome she had been reading and crossed her arms. "Huh? Oh!" you reply in embarrassment when you realized you still had your hood and mask on.

You let out a chuckle as you pull back your hood and stuff your mask back inside your robes. "Recognize me now?" you ask as her eyes go wide. "It's... it's you! My word! It must have been a year!" she exclaims as she pours a glass of wine and hands it to you. "You look quite a bit different now, even your voice has changed a little."

"The same could be said for you." you say with a laugh as you sip the wine and point towards Foxglove's head. She had always had white hair, but the ram horns and colorfully morphed pupils were definitely new. She suppresses a grin and pulls a length of hair away from her enchanted eyes. "So kind of you to notice, a girl does like to get compliments on her appearance now and then."

You finished off the glass of wine and leaned back in your chair a little. "Want another glass? My team just made a huge breakthrough on the flesh eating mushrooms and got a nice payday from the local guild head so I've got plenty of cash at the moment." Foxglove says as she finishes off her own glass and gestures for another bottle to be brought over.
13223.title: Catching Up

choices: Down the whole glass at once
Mix it with some wine for an extra kick
132231.content:
Foxglove rolled her eyes as a barmaid came over and sat a bottle of fresh wine on the table. "Top shelf huh? I guess I have enough for a bottle of Silver Serpent, but you'll need to put up a quarter of the cost if I do." she replied as she handed the barmaid some coins for the wine. You let out a sigh, this was going to hurt your savings...but there was no way you'd turn down a bottle of Silver Serpent. That stuff was as potent as undercity grog, only without the nasty aftertaste or blacking out.

"I guess I can afford that..." you say as you dig a handful of coins out of a hidden pocket in your robe. After counting out your portion of the cost you add it to a small stack of money on the table next to the fresh bottle of wine. "A bottle of Silver Serpent, please." Foxglove says as she hands the stack of coins to the barmaid, who nods and walks back over to the front counter.

A minute later she returns carrying a polished silver bottle with pale platinum trimmings wrapped around it like vines. The bottle was fairly small, only about two thirds of the size of the nearby wine bottle and was capped with a blue enchanted seal on top of the stopper. Foxglove wasted no time in peeling the seal away and popping the cap off with a loud squeak. A cloudy sky blue aroma rose from the shimmering white liquid inside as it was poured and then evaporated as quickly as it had appeared.

"This drained most of my funds, so you'd better enjoy this." Foxglove said teasingly as she handed you your glass. You took a moment to breathe in and savor the rich smell of this exotic drink. It hadn't even touched your tongue yet and you could already taste the mana-enhanced flavor of this magical blend as you brought the glass to your lips. "Thanks for the treat, Foxy." you say with a mischievous grin as Foxglove rolls her eyes again. She always did hate your little nicknames for her...
132231.title: Every Sip Has A Silver Lining

choices: You fall into a deep sleep
1322313.content:
"What are you doing?" Foxglove asks worriedly as you pick up the bottle of wine and pull a small bit into your glass of Silver Serpent, which belches out a thick purplish-red cloud of steam. "Spicing this baby up a bit." you reply with a grin on your face. "How often am I gonna be able to enjoy a bottle of Silver Serpent and wine at the same time?"

Foxglove puts a hand on her face and lets out a sigh. "Just don't poison yourself, I don't have the coin to get you treated by a cleric." she replies as she takes a small sip of her own drink. You just give her a fresh smile as you down the entire glass in one big gulp, barely reacting to the sensation of burning acid being poured down your throat.

"Are you okay?" Foxglove asks nervously as your eyes begin to water. "I'm completely fine." you reply as you take the bottle of wine and down half of it to get the taste of burning off of your tongue. Foxglove just stares in shock as your eyes turn a dark purplish red and you let out a loud burp.

The whole world is spinning and you open your mouth to say something, but no words or even sounds come out. You pick up the wine bottle one last time without even realizing it and down the the rest of the liquid inside. The last thing you see before collapsing is a look of genuine fear on your friend's face.

You open your eyes to a hellish ruin of Ravnica wreathed in flames and darkness. All of the buildings are collapsed and eerie lights flicker among the shadows. "What is going on?" you ask aloud, having finally found your voice. No answer comes but a faint whisper that echoes over the rubble in front of you.

"Stop the darkness from coming. Stop the..."

You hear a loud church bell ring as the nightmare world crumbles away around you and you fall into a void. You try to scream, only to find that your voice has once again left you. After nearly a minute of falling...
1322313.title: Lights Out

choices: Stop by a bench to rest a bit before moving on
Head back to your Rakdos boss and see if you can get an extension on your task
13223131.content:
You can faintly hear words that sound like your name as you slowly open your eyes. A blurry humanoid figure is standing over you and a thin cloud of hazy purple fog begins to fade on the edges of your vision. You blink and the world slowly comes back into focus as feeling returns to your body.

"Foxy? Whoah...what...what happened to me?" you gasp as you sit up. Foxglove looks close to tears, but hides it with a mask of anger as you turn your attention to her. "You could have been killed, you idiot!" she shouts as a few of the other patrons begin crowding around you to see what all the commotion is.

"I...I'm sorry. I just...ahh...my head..." you groan as the last effects of the drink cocktail begin to fade from your mind. "The city...fire...darkness...some kind of vision..." Some of the nearby people begin to chuckle as you struggle back to your feet with Foxglove's help. She was the only one who seemed the least bit worried about what you were saying. "A vision? Fire? Darkness? What do you mean?" she asked.

You rubbed your head as you tried to keep from falling over again. Luckily, all of your senses seemed to be intact and were quickly returning. "I...I don't know..." you reply while your friend gives you another worried look. "When I passed out...I saw Ravnica...just...destroyed with fire and darkness surrounding it. I have no idea what it means..." At this point one of the guys standing behind you breaks into a laughing fit alongside his buddies.

Foxglove merely gives them a glare as she listens to your story, seemingly disturbed by the details you give her. "It sounds like an old story...or a legend a friend of mine came across in an old tome somewhere. I can't remember what it's called, but I can probably look it up." she says as she finishes off the last of her wine. "YOU need to get home and get some rest."

You shake your head as memories of the previous day come back to you slowly. "I can't I have to- OH NO!" you gasp as you realized you still had unfinished errands to run for your guild. "Foxy, how long was I out?" you ask worriedly as you stand up from your chair. "Huh? About ten minutes." she replies in a mildly surprised tone. "You really had me worried you jerk."

"Only ten minutes... I can probably still do this then." you say to yourself as you run to the door and wave Foxglove goodbye. "Sorry to drink and run Foxy, but I've got official Rakdos business to attend to!" She tries to protest, but you are already out the door before she can say anything. You hated to cut your reunion short, but you had a lot of work ahead of you.
13223131.title: What Is To Come

1323.content:
You grin as you head off the main road and talk a back street through a shady part of town. Rats scurried away as you moved silently through the narrow alley shadows past various grates and gutters filled with muck and slime. As you came back out to an adjacent road leading towards a large gate you reached into your robes and put on a mask to disguise yourself. The last thing you needed was someone from the guild to recognize you and report you for slacking on the job.

As you pass through the gate you notice several swaying banners bearing the logo of the Simic, a guild specializing in blue and green magic. They were "allied" with you at the moment, but that hardly mattered in a city like this where it was everyone for themselves. Just because the Simic probably wouldn't attack you on sight didn't make you friends, especially since they had radically different views on magic and several other matters.

You pushed the thoughts of the ongoing war out of your mind as you came upon a slum area filled with goblins, ogres, stray creatures and several other types of vermin... your kind of place, really. You passed a vagrant chewing on a dead rat and walked up to a short building nestled snugly between two large housing complexes. This was the place.

You knocked twice on the door and waited patiently for someone to walk up to the barred window. "Password." came a deep voice from the other side. "Payday." you whisper back as you lean on the door. The person on the other side grunts and unlocks a hatch to allow you inside. "Welcome." the large ogre says as he pulls the door open and ushers you inside. The interior of the large room was hazy in the dim candlelight, but the place had anything you could ask for in a good gambling den. What do you want to do first?
1323.title: Gambling Man

choices: Begin mixing the two mana sources
Get up and see what the other Izzet are up to
133.content:
You looked over your work desk as various beakers, test tubes and bits of machinery hummed and glowed with arcane light. It was your first day as an initiate of the Izzet League and you wanted to make a good first impression, but thoughts and ideas seemed to come to you slowly today. You knew the basics of red and blue mana as did every other member, though combining them in new and unexpected ways often proved challenging for even the guild's more senior members.

You grabbed a vial of bright blue energy that seemed to float and swirl through the glass like an ocean's tide ebbing and flowing. This was blue mana, a powerful catalyst to mind magic and the endless depths of the sea and sky. After looking it over for a moment you then grabbed a vial of crimson red light similar to the first. Unlike blue mana, this energy was more savage and wild, flaring up and glowing intensely through the glass as if it might pop out at any second or melt its container into a hot puddle of lava. As you carefully studied the two magical energies in your hands and looked out over your work desk you finally had an idea...
133.title: Brainstorming Session

choices: Find another "willing" participant to test it for you?
Do a little research about what your other guildmates are working on.
1332.content:
So long as you get the balance just right, you can make improvements on the standard staticaster. While a great weapon in its own right, what it lacks is precision. For now, most models just shoot a high concentration of energy wherever. While that makes for an amazing show and certainly makes one think before they shoot, that could have some nasty effects in the long-term, especially if you hit someone on your side. Hmm, just a little more blue mana and you can make it more focused.

The rest of the world may think the Izzet are just a bunch of absent-minded children who go from one exciting toy to the next, but you know better. There is focus, precise thought, and obsession. But, it's all a puzzle, where all the pieces need to be put together in a certain order. Only if you know what the picture is as a whole, will you be able to see the method in the madness. Niv Mizzet knows that picture, and that's why he's the one deciding the order of things. Today, part of that includes working on this order on behalf of the Boros Legion. They need new, improved weaponry. Oh sure, they are technically part of the enemy "alliance," but again, that is all part of Mizzet's puzzle. So long as the Alliance can think they have a chance of getting the Izzet on their side, you and the rest of the inventors could have free range to continue your work. More importantly, you think, Niv Mizzet thrives on continuing the strife between the Alliance and the Resistance for some grander scheme. At least, you hope so. Surely, the dragon guild leader cannot be happy taking a back seat to those unrefined Gruul.

Just a few more tweaks there, make sure the Mizzium pin is secure, and done! You have a new prototype for an advanced staticaster. There's only one thing to do now, test it, but should you...
1332.title: The Prototype

choices: Who cares what she thinks? She's just a Selesnya.
Run, just run. No point in dealing with useless confrontation.
13321.content:
Of course the only person skilled enough to test this is yourself. Besides, much as you appreciate your guildmates, you don't want them stealing your best ideas. You pack up your gear and decide to head into the city to find a good place for target practice.

There are those who complain of how urban Ravnica has become, such as the Selesnya, the Gruul, or even the Simic, to an extent, but you find it rather cozy. Who could hate all the sights and sounds? You shuffle through the crowds in the market, enjoying the sounds of people shouting their hellos across the street, or the haggling of the vendors. And is that sweet smell one of your favorite foods from the carts? You'll have to make a stop on your way back.

You find an open courtyard and start setting up. No one seems to find it odd that you're strapping the device to your arm. There are stranger things that have been seen in Ravnica, mostly due to the antics of the Rakdos, but still... There isn't much going on, and you've pretty much got the place to yourself. There are a few Orzhov's discussing business in the corner, a Selesnya cleric tending to some massive plant, and a few kids playing a game off to the side.

You take aim at a stone pillar in the courtyard. You don't plan on hitting it with that much power anyway, so it won't cause too much damage. Your invention whirs to life, and you can't help but be a little proud of it. You take the shot before anyone around you can object. Unfortunately, the shot had a lot more power behind it than you expected. It hits the pillar, ricochets off of it, and blasts the phytohydra the Selesnya woman was working on into pieces. Hm, that's an interesting reaction, you note. It did hit the target, but then more calculations are going to have to be run.

In the meantime, the Selesnya woman is standing before you, a look on her face that indicates she is livid with anger. On the one hand, she's just a Selesnya. What would it matter to you what you did to her plant. On the other hand, you can't deny that she is attractive. She's a tall, thin elf with long dark hair that cascades down past her shoulders, and even though they're glaring at you with anger, she does have pretty brown eyes. You stutter as you prepare for your next move.
13321.title: Work-Related Accidents

choices: One of the Rakdos performers had their act go too far.
You both get accosted by an Azorious Arrester.
A deal goes sour with an Orzhav and a bar fight errupts.
133212.content:
"Uh, I..." you begin, trying to find your words. While she is just a Selesnya, you can sympathize with losing important work. "I'm sorry," you manage to blurt out. "I didn't mean to hit that, uh that..."

"It happened to be a rare phytohydra, the last of its kind," she snaps. "What in the world were you thinking? Let me take a guess; you were only thinking about that metal atrocity in your hands and not the damage you could have done. Typical Izzet."

Now you're starting to wonder why you wanted to apologize to her. "I didn't mean to," is all you can think to say.

"Of course you didn't 'mean' to," she explains. "You and your league never think of the consequences, you just do for the sake of a thrill and what you call 'experimenting.' Like children, honestly."

She starts to walk off in a huff, and really you should probably just drop the matter. Yet, something beckons you to keep trying. "Listen, let me make it up to you over a drink. I know this great place and-"

"You honestly think that can make up for all the hard work of the Conclave you've destroyed?"

"Well, no, but..."

"And why do you even care? Afraid I'll report you to the Azorius?"

"No, because you weren't supposed to be growing it there anyway. You turn me in, and you incriminate yourself."

This gives her pause. She must've not realized how much thought you gave into that. She crosses her arms, still studying you, and you figure she's trying to get a read on you. "So, then why do you care about apologizing? It's not like our guilds are allies."

You shrug. "Far from it, I know, but I really do feel bad. I mean, I would know how bad I would feel if someone inadvertently destroyed one of my inventions. Look, I know our work is different, and I really don't care all that much about what you do, but it is your work. We all take pride in what we do, and I feel bad that I ruined that. So please, just give me a chance."

She takes a deep breath, clearly looking like she's weighing her options. Finally, she says, "Fine, it's actually been a while since I've ever been out on the town just for fun. But don't think this means I forgive you. I'm just giving you a chance."

You flash a wide grin. "That's all I ask."

XXX

You wait that night at a local Rakdos tavern, wondering if this was really such a good idea. Chances are she wouldn't even bother coming, and all you'd end up doing is wasting precious time in the workshop. Plus, you wonder why you're even bothering with this silly notion. Has simple biology robbed you of your senses that quickly?

You're about to give up on the idea when you find she's standing right behind you. "Surprised you even remembered," she says. "Aren't the Izzet known for being absent-minded."

"Hey, we just know how to switch focus when we need to."

She rolls her eyes, but you can detect a slight hint of playfulness in the gesture. "Alright, well, I'm waiting for this grand apology."

"I thought I apologized this morning. My offer was to make it up to you."

"Ah, so drinks is 'making it up.'"

"Sort of," you say. "Look, I've got some connections with the Simics, and maybe I can get them to help recreate a bud of the plant I destroyed using some of the DNA that was left on my staticaster. Found a few remnants of it stuck inside when I got back."

She seems slightly impressed by this, and actually at a loss for words. No snappy comeback, for once. "Oh, well...thank you, but...why are you doing this?"

You give a leery look to the hulking Rakdos fellow who drops off your drinks. On your side, they may be, but that doesn't shake the uneasiness you get when you see some of their more frightening members. "It was something important to you, and I broke it. I thought I'd fix it."

"You're a very direct person," she says, "and I just can't understand it."

You laugh. "Yeah, people say that a lot. So, in all of this, I never got your name."

"Inyeni," she answers. "I guess I really should thank you...I never got your name either."

Before you can answer, you hear a great commotion coming from behind you.
133212.title: More to Life than Guilds

choices: Back to work. What's your latest invention?
You get called to speak with the Firemind, Niv-Mizzet himself. Why?
You just got an order for new weapons from the Boros. Ugh, work sucks.
1332123.content:
“You can’t do this!” you hear someone shout.

You turn slightly to see an Orzhav cardinal with a couple of thugs shaking down someone for money. Typical day in Ravnica, you think, but you do realize the delicate situation this could be. Even Inyeni seems a little on edge. She looks to you warily, her elven ears fully erect. “It was your choice to do things the hard way,” the Orzhav says. “Now, I’ll ask again, can you pay back your loan or can’t you.”

“Consider this your payback!” the man spits as he hauls off and kicks the Orzhav square in the jaw. He falls back and slams onto your table.

Both of you bolt up and out of the way immediately. Things are about to go from bad to worse, you know. The Orzhav wipes the blood from his bleeding lip. “You will pay sorely for this,” he says, commanding his thugs.

Total chaos erupts. As the thugs and the man fight, more people in the bar get pulled into the brawl. Several Rakdos workers get involved just for the thrill of it, and now you know it’s gotten out of hand. You grab Inyeni’s wrist and bolt out the nearest exit, just as a pack of Azorius arresters come to break it up. That’ll just ensure more chaos, you know. When it comes to Rakdos taverns, anything goes, and nothing the Azorius can do will stop the insanity. Besides, your inventions have gotten you a decent rap sheet, and it’s best to get out before the senate recognizes you.

You drag her through a series of winding alleyways, trying to get as far away from the chaos as possible. Only after you’re a good distance away do you stop to catch your breath. “Sorry about that,” you say between gasps for air. “I guess I should’ve picked a safer spot.”

She smiles bashfully. “Actually, I’ve never had that kind of excitement before. The Conclave is exceptionally dull compared to that. It was actually…fun.”

“Really?” you say, a little too eagerly. You try to recover your composure. “I mean, yeah, when you get away from all the rules and communal living, life can be fun. You should try it out more often.”

She shrugs. “It was hard enough getting time away from the Conclave, but I suppose I will have to try again. After all, you never got to finish your apology.” She smiles coyly as she says this.

You’re about to correct her, when it finally sinks in what she’s implying. “Um, yeah, but maybe without anything that exciting. Well, I guess we’re at Sumala. I suppose you have to go now.”

She looks behind her at the beautiful gardens of Sumala. “I suppose so,” she says, just a little disappointed. “Enjoy your dusty old labs.”

She leaves, and you’re not entirely sure what just happened, but you liked it. Course, she could be just another distraction from your work. But who knows? Maybe you’re paths will cross again.
