1332123.title: Bar Brawl

choices: None of the canisters work. Back to the drawing board.
Only one canister works, but it's the most expensive to make.
You luck out. All of them work. Now you just got to adjust the structure.
13321231.content:
You wake up to find one of your higher-ups giving you your next assignment. Your job is to figure out either a new metal or a new structure to improve the mana wells in the Izzet tunnels. Apparently, the Firemind desires something that can withstand a large increase in pressure. Hm, the possibilities...

You also begin to wonder what on earth this might be for. Again, that part of your mind is fairly silent because only Niv-Mizzet knows why and you shouldn't question it. You take out some parchment and begin scrawling out your ideas as well as making careful notes and measurements. You quickly realize that the best course of action is to start developing a new metal alloy that can handle great pressures without buckling. You find you have three ideas that just might work. However, while you are a great chemister, you're not much of a whiz in metallurgy.

Luckily, you know just the place to go. Krubex can cut, shape, and smith any kind of metal you need, and he just so happens to be a close friend and fellow guildmate. You pack up your stuff and make your way to the boiler system tunnels underground. The goblin's workshop isn't far. You find your friend hard at work, welding away, while his various assistants and automata clink and slam away at other projects. Over the din you shout out, "Krubex, what's going on?"

The short little goblin stops and turns around, taking off his goggles. "Hey, how are ya?" he says, coughing a little. "I haven't seen you in ages. Oh, this? Eh, just some new armor for the Boros. Not a top priority. What can I do ya for?"

You show him your designs. "See, this one requires..." You begin explaining the percentages of the metals to him for each of your designs. "Can you do it?"

He scratches at the stubble on his chin. "Mizzium's harder to make alloys with, but worth a shot. You came to the right place. Most metallurgists wouldn't even try. Tell ya what, I'll work on this, and I think the old forge needs some tinkering. I swear it's leaking something. Can ya take a look?"

That's one of the things that you love about the Izzet. Usually, so long as you're willing to scratch someone else's back, work and progress get done pretty easily, not like some of the other guilds who try to micromanage themselves, like the Orzhav or the Selesnyans. You take a look at Krubex's forge. Sure enough, it's leaking fuel. Probably could use an improved coolant too, now that you think about it. It's a good thing you carry a lot of your supplies with you on a daily basis. Always be prepared, you remember.

It takes most of the afternoon, but you leave Krubex's forge in better shape than when it was brand new, and he's more than satisfied with it. "Perfect, I should be able to finish this order for the Boros on schedule. Here are your samples."

He gives you three canisters made from your new metal alloys. Your plan is to take them back to the lab and run them through some tests to see how much pressure they can stand.
13321231.title: Back to work. What's your latest invention?

133213.content: Not sure quite how much power your new invention had left, and being unprepared for an all out brawl, you start sprinting down the street. You hear an angry shout, and all of a sudden a small sprout breaks out of the ground and clings to your leg, tripping you. You fear for the worst as you see the druid still running towards you, until what looms like a cross between a dragon and a giant fish comes slithering out and lights the woman on fire. You can tell things are getting out of hand as you see an azorius mage come rushing onto the scene. Luckily, you now have time to escape- or do you stand and fight?
133213.title: Run, just run. No point in dealing with useless...

13322.content:
You carefully secure your new toy and lock up your lab before heading out into the main hall to find a proper test subject to try it out on. Other members of the guild were busy discussing various ideas and trying out their own inventions as you carefully walked by towards the center of the room where a group of new initiates were busy fiddling with... something strange. Two men, one woman, a male goblin and a female elf were all arguing and trying to put various doohickeys and knobs on an odd round contraption that spouted steam and sparks every few seconds.

"Oh, this looks like a nice group, lots of potential for testing and, hopefully, recovery." you think to yourself as you walk over to where the elf woman was hammering something sticking out of the side of the device. "Hello, fellow apprentice of the scientific arts, may I ask what your group is doing here?" you question as you give her a friendly smile.

"Well, I'm trying to build a revolutionary new guard for our front gates, but these morons are ruining my work!" she replies as one of the men tightens a knob that sprays steam into her face. "Ha, more like me and my wife are making a powerful new lab aid to assist in running experiments!" he calls back as the woman next to him gives him a high five. "No, I'm making a new food delivery system!" The other man replies as he pulls a loose gear from the machine, causing the whole thing to shut down as the group begins to argue even louder than before.

Awkwardly, you turn to the goblin as he continues to hit the dormant invention with a large metal hammer while shouting furiously. "Uh, what are YOU trying to make?" you ask over the growing noise. "SMASHY! SMASHY! ME MAKE MESS! YEAH!" he replies enthusiastically as he swings harder and harder. Truly you have a well-rounded group of potential applicants to test your new staticaster on...but who should get the honor?
13322.title: Working Hard Or Hardly Working?

133222.content:
You pull the elf woman aside as she wipes the steam residue off her face with a rag and fixes her hair. "Can you believe them? They have no idea what they're doing! At this rate we'll never get anything done!" she rants as she puts the rag away and straightens her robes. "I need a new team who know how to mix mana properly without causing it to blow up in their face... or mine!"

You smile and put an arm around her shoulder. "Clearly those small minded fools were lucky to have such an asset on their team, didn't even know what they had. Not like me... I could really use a superior mind such as yours with a few of my own experiments, if you're interested...?" you reply as she rubs her chin and looks back at the mess her colleges were still in the process of creating. "Alright, I might be able to lend a hand for now, lead the way." she says with a smile.

You grin as you grab her hand and lead her away from her friends. "Just this way my dear, I've got the perfect place to test my- OUR new invention!" you say excitedly as you take her...
133222.title: New Assistant

choices: Begin research on some of your lab creatures
Begin research on some of your lab plants
Head out to the market for some fresh air and supplies
134.content:
You woke up just as the sun began spreading over the towering cityscape just outside your bedroom window. The past few days had been extremely busy, but you were quick to get out of bed as you still had much work to do. Amazingly enough, your presentation to the Simic Combine a week before had impressed them enough to take you on as an initiate in their guild. Along with a new apartment within walking distance of one of their research halls you had been gifted with a small garden laboratory kit to conduct experiments in.

Unfortunately, you haven't really had much time to work with it due to all the unpacking and cleaning you've had to do. The apartment was nice, but way too small for you to properly get any big projects done. You let out a sigh as you looked around your overcrowded bedroom and got dressed. Everything from books, jars, plant pots and medical tools were stacked upon the tables and shelves, leaving little to no room for anything not related to your newfound guild. After a quick breakfast you did a bit more cleaning up and organizing to make the place slightly more livable.

As you began cooking a small lunch you noticed that it was nearly noon already, far too late in the day to have done nothing productive. "I've got another presentation due in just over a week and I haven't made any progress whatsoever since I moved in..." you say worriedly as you quickly look over a few papers while eating. In another hour you've only had the time to properly set up your experiment zone and sort the equipment you'd need for the tasks ahead of you. Things were certainly going slow, but you were determined to not disappoint the Simic after being given such a great opportunity. What's next?
134.title: Darwin Would Be Proud

choices: The charms seller and fortune teller
Tip one of the street performers
1343.content:
You really needed some fresh air and a few fresh supplies so you packed a small satchel with some money and field equipment and headed out into the busy city street. Several shops selling various magical goods could be seen on both sides, but the market square was likely to be the only place large enough to have what you needed unless you wanted to hike into Selesnya territory. Luckily, it was only a mile away and deep inside Simic territory.

As you walked you noticed a few people dressed in red clothing and wearing bright platinum armor of some kind. They looked like they could just be mercenaries, but red and white were the colors of the Boros, a powerful enemy faction full of aggressive warriors. On the other hand, it was unlikely that any Alliance guilds would try anything this deep in enemy territory with their only back up possibly miles away.

You brushed it off as a mere coincidence and let them pass by without so much as a greeting. Even if they were spies or assassins you had enough mana stored in your satchel to defend yourself if they did try anything. In another few minutes you finally arrived in the massive market square, which was just as busy as ever. In addition to hundreds of merchant tents and stands offering various wares were colorful banners hanging between the towering buildings and street performers trying to earn enough coin for a drink or two at the end of the day.

It was still pretty early in the afternoon and you had plenty of time to browse, what kind of shop do you want to visit?
1343.title: A Day At The Market

choices: Try to stop the fire from spreading
13433.content:
You pull a coin out of your satchel and toss it into a hat in front of a crowd of jugglers and clowns. One of the female clowns, a tall elf woman, tosses you a rose in return that she pulled from a sleeve. You wave goodbye and are just about to continue on to the shops when a large explosion echoed just a few blocks away near a large garden district. Your first instinct is to let the guards handle it, but then you realize that the direction the smoke is coming from is right next to a Simic clinic.

"I'd better at least investigate this..." you mutter under your breath as you run past a crowd of worried civilians. You see a few of your fellow guildmates heading in the direction of the disaster as well along the way, clearly this was something big. You round a corner and nearly knock a portly man over as he flees from the clouds of smoke and fire. "Oh no..." you whisper softy as you look upon the ghastly scene before you.

Several buildings were on fire and half of the public garden was blanketed in flames and smoke. There didn't appear to be many injured, but several people were laying dead under piles of debris and rubble. The clinic you had hoped to investigate was little more than a thin charred frame that looked seconds away from collapse. "Who did this...?" came the shocked voice of one of the other Simic to arrive, a young woman with light green skin and flowing blue hair.

You didn't answer and merely began walking forward as the blaze roared around you.
13433.title: Things Heat Up

choices: Keep saving as many people as you can
Help the elf man extinguish the fire
Try to do a little of both
134331.content:
You pulled a tiny glass vial from your satchel and wasted no time as you popped the cork off. Glowing green runes flared up on its sides as a warm primal energy flowed over your hands. There were many spells and abilities you could call upon, but you didn't want to waste more mana than necessary and recalled a simple but useful augment to your natural sight.

You focused the green mana through your body and felt it rushing to your head like a roaring stampede of wild beasts. As bright green veins lit up in your arms, chest and neck you closed your eyes and placed your right hand over them. After a few seconds passed you opened your new eyes to survey the disaster before you.

Each of your pupils was now slit like a cat or snake and dyed a deep thick green. Everything before you was now much more dark, like a vast shadow had passed over the land, but your vision was much more clear. Bright red and orange pockets of glowing energy, body heat, came into focus all around you. Some were fading under the rubble and some were partially obscured by the burning yellow flames around them but there was no mistake that they were all Ravnican citizens.

"Let's rescue the civilians first, after that we can find out who did this!" you call out as you run towards a collapsed wall to help the crumpled form resting underneath. "On it!" came the determined reply of the blue-haired Simic woman as she rushed ahead of you and sent out a thick wave of vines to shield the area from falling ash and debris. "What about the fires?!" A large elf man called as he charged up an orb of blue light on his left hand.

"We have to save everyone we can, even if it means we lose some property!" you shout back as you pull a wounded man out from under a broken chair. "Damn it, we'll lose too much research if we let the clinic storage burn!" the elf man yells as he unleashes a blast of ice shards on the blaze spreading out from the ruined clinic. You ignore him as you and the Simic woman help a little girl trapped behind an overturned bookshelf.

Things are starting to look pretty bad...
134331.title: Out Of The Frying Pan...

choices: Congratulate your guildmates on a job well done
Thank the other guilds for their help
Investigate the burnt ruins of the clinic
1343311.content:
You help an older woman to safety as the front half of the Simic research clinic collapses into a pile of burnt ash. "Damn it, the research!" the elf man growls as he shoots a massive spray of ice crystals at the central blaze. The fire retreats slightly, but continues to burn as smoke and steam fill the air.

"I think she was the last one!" the Simic woman calls as she rises to her feet. You take a quick look around and nod your head. "I think you're right, I don't see anymore trapped civilians!" you reply as your eyes return to normal. "Now we just need to stop this fire." The two of you rush over to the elf man as he struggles to stop the blaze from spreading.

"About time, what the hell were you doing?" the elf man asks angrily as he as he wipes a bead of sweat from his face. "Sorry, we had to protect the citizens." you answer back as you pop the cork out of a vial of glowing blue energy and absorb its power. "Idiots, just help me stop this." the elf man replies as he charges up another spell.

The three of you call upon powerful blue magic as other members of the Simic and a few other friendly guilds show up to lend a hand. A Golgari man uses a decay spell to crumble a wall shielding most of the fire and an Izzet woman sends a powerful gust of pure mana energy to smother the flames. "Nice work!" you yell as you and your guildmates charge a powerful tsunami blast to finish the inferno off.

A towering wave of glowing blue mana floods the nearby district in water as the fire is finally pushed back. A final cloud of smoke begins to rise as the last few flames die down and the charred skeletons of the nearby buildings begin to collapse. In a few seconds the only trace of the disaster would be a few tiny embers and enough charred wood to fill a small forest.

"We did it...!" you gasp as you collapse backwards onto the ground next your allies. What next?
1343311.title: Into The Fire!

choices: Try to stealthily grab the object
Try to distract the lawmage and then grab the object
Leave the object alone and comply with the lawmage's orders
13433113.content:
You stand up and rub your head a bit as the strain of casting such a powerful spell begins to slowly fade away. "You okay?" the Simic woman asks as you walk over to the ruins of the burned clinic. "Yeah, I just want to poke around and see if I can find anything. Something tells me this wasn't an accident." you reply as you fish a magnifying glass out of your satchel.

"Alright then, the guards will probably arrive soon. I'll try to keep them busy while you work." the Simic woman says as she heads over to the growing crowd of onlookers talking with the heroes that saved the entire district from burning down. "Thanks, I'll try not to take to long." you call back, unsure if she heard you as you turn over a singed board with your foot.

Aside from ash and embers there wasn't a lot to go on. There were a few intact books and chests in the piles of soot, but their contents were completely unrecognizable and burnt beyond salvation. In a few minutes Azorious lawmages joined the crowd of people alongside several patrolling watchmen. "Ugh, who invited them?" you whisper to yourself as you toss aside a chipped piece of wood.

"You there! This is a potential crime scene, step away from the disaster area!" one of the lawmages yells as his partner begins taking statements from the crowd of citizens and guild members. You groan, but notice something out of the corner of your eye just as you are about to get back on your feet. It was a tiny bronze object leaning against what had once been a chair, if not for the thin rays of sunlight penetrating the dissipating clouds of smoke you would have missed it for sure.

You rub your chin as the lawmage takes a few steps closer. You'd get in serious trouble if he saw you pick it up, but it was the only clue you had at the moment...
13433113.title: From The Ashes

choices: Head through one of the doors
Turn down your light and wait for a bit
135.content:
You silently creep deeper into the winding tangle of sewer tunnels as your lantern begins to grow dim. You had only packed enough oil for a few hours, hoping that the meeting with the Golgari official would be quick and easy... no such luck. It was already dusk when you had arrived at the sewer entrance an hour ago and soon all you would have for illumination would be the occasional thin crack of moonlight shining down from a hole or the eerie glow of sewer bugs and spirits.

You poured the last bit of your oil into the lantern and took a right turn into a wide tunnel with a large rotting tree at its end, along with several wooden doors. As you drew closer you noticed the crude outline of the Golgari symbol etched into the tree and cloaked by shadows. You smiled and breathed a small sigh of relief. "At least I'm headed in the right direction..." you whisper as you hold up your light to get a better look.
135.title: Under The Streets

choices: A large campsite filled with tents surrounded by shallow murky water
A series of ancient stone ruins covered in moss and algie
An underground crypt filled with wooden caskets and large stone coffins
1353.content:
You dimmed your lantern to save oil and and walked over to the tree to wait for a bit. If no one came along you could always move on, but barging through doors uninvited in Golgari turf wasn't just impolite, it was extremely dangerous. Anything from poisonous insects to diseased rats to even gorgons could be waiting just on the other side... no, it was better to wait for an escort or leave and try another night.

Just as you were about to turn around and head back you felt a slender hand lightly grab your shoulder from behind. You turned around to see a tall slim figure hooded in black robes with dark green trimmings standing not two feet away from you. "Hello stranger, are you the applicant I am to meet with, or merely a trespasser?" came a soft voice from beneath the hood. You weren't sure if the figure could see you in the dark and smiled just in case.

"Hello, I'm the one who sent the message to your official earlier. I'd like to join you." you reply as you extend your hand for a handshake. The figure nods her head and grabs your hand gently. "Welcome brother, I'll take you to the outpost to see our leader. Please follow me closely." she says as she lets go of your hand. In an instant she is moving swiftly for one of the wooden doors and you have to nearly run to catch up with her as she closes the door firmly behind her.

After several minutes of navigating tight passageways choked with roots, muck and weeds you both arrive at...
1353.title: Underground Escort

choices: Ask her how she end up here
13531.content:
The hooded figure remains silent as she walks ahead into a small clearing and waits for you to catch up. After brushing aside some tangling roots you walk out to accompany her. Ahead of you was a large campsite made up of several tattered tents stretched over thin sticks and bones surrounding a small campfire where a cauldron of some sort was brewing something. Several figures in robes and scavenged armor walked about, paying you no mind as they went about their business.

Some of the people were humans wearing face paint, some leaner figures appeared to be elves and a few were completely unidentifiable under their hoods and armor. The place has a strange sense of unease about it but also a sort of... peace? Tranquility? You weren't sure what exactly the right word was, but it gave you a calming feeling and made you feel welcome as your guide led you up to a tent with the Golgari symbol carefully sewn into the front.

"You must go in alone to show your worth to the Swarm... good luck brother." the hooded figure instructed as she walked off to assist one of her fellows. "If you pass your test come see me, the name's Shucca. Farewell." You took a breath and parted the tent enough to step inside and were immediate greeted by a voice that sounded like a low hiss. Your eyes were still adjusting to the light, but there was no mistaking the creature that slithered before you.

A coiled gorgon beckoned you closer as a soft whispery voiced escaped her lips. "Welcome my child, I am the elder of this outpost. I am to test your merit and see if you fit in with the Golgari Swarm." The words sounded compassionate, but you were still unnerved as you stepped closer. One wrong look from her and you could kiss your chance at becoming a Golgari or anything else goodbye. "Hello, I am ready." you speak up as you tried to sound confident.

The gorgon lets out a soft laugh as she slithers a bit closer. "Don't worry. I'm not going to turn you to stone... as a matter of fact, I can't." she says softly as you finally catch a glimpse of her head in the dim light and gasp. Half of her upper face was chewed away by savage scars and a thin blindfold covered her hollow eye sockets. She had suffered some sort of near lethal attack... or torture. Your mind races quickly as you try to come up with a response.
13531.title: Meeting The Elder

14.content: Good, now choose a guild.
14.title: For Freedom!

choices: Ignore the sign and forge your own path
141.content:
You walked along the trail slowly as night began to fall, careful to stay close to the guiding light of the touches hung from tree branches and rocky outcroppings. The air was cool with a faint breeze, but your hood kept you warm enough as you stepped over the mossy cobblestones and broken branches.

You were not even a full mile outside the official city limits and yet the terrain in front of you has already drastically shifted. Instead of smooth streets and tall buildings you found yourself surrounded by trees and kicking up small clouds of dust and rock every time you stepped off the main trail even slightly. All told, the wilderness in this district only covered about 20-30 square miles, though it seemed just as savage as a jungle the size of a continent.

After nearly twenty minutes of walking you came across a faded wooden sign leaning off to the side of the path. On one end was a painting of a green arrow pointing right with a picture of small triangles and lines above it, probably meant to be tents and people. The other end had a red arrow pointing left with a bunch of smooth crescent shapes sketched below it, which seemed to represent hills or maybe domes of some kind. Which way do you go?
141.title: Welcome To The Jungle

choices: Tell the Gruul why you're here
1411.content:
You figured that a camp or outpost of some sort would be the most likely place to find a Gruul leader who could induct you into the group so you head down the trail leading through a dense forested area. It was a little hard to navigate with all of the thick foliage and low hanging branches and vines, but you knew joining the Gruul wouldn't be easy and prepared for this very occasion.

You take a large jagged knife you had bought from the city market just before closing and cut through a thick tangle of plants that had grown over the trail ahead. You had to slow your pace a bit as you hacked past fleeing animals and buzzing insects, but you were making pretty good time, all things considered. There were few torches this far out, but the dim light from a lantern you had bought kept you from tripping over anything.

Finally, after nearly an hour of slow progress you came upon a small clearing nestled snugly below the towering trees and rocks. In this clearing was a small cave along with a cook pot hanging over a burning fire and a couple of tents made from animal hides and scavenged cloth. You begin to approach the camp when three elf men dressed in loincloths, beads and fang necklaces step out from behind you and hold a knife to your throat.

"This is Gruul turf and we don't like trespassers." the head elf says as his two friends step in front of you, each holding a deadly hunting spear. "Why did you come here? Answer us or we'll kill you and take what you have for the clan." You pause for a moment as you look over the two elf hunters in front of you. It might be possible to escape if you take them by surprise, but antagonizing them would definitely antagonize the Gruul leadership as well. How do you respond?
1411.title: A Surprise Encounter

choices: "Can we settle this some other way? Is a trial really necessary?"
"I'll take the trespasser punishment for now, but I'll be back one day!"
14111.content:
You turn your head to face the elf with the knife at your throat and take a breath. "Hello, I'm sorry for trespassing, but I would like to join the Gruul." you say while making sure not to make any sudden movements. The two elves with spears begin laughing as their leader lets out a dry chuckle.

"Join the Gruul? A city girl such as yourself?" he replies as he lowers his blade a little. "Just admit to scavenging for supplies and relics in Gruul territory and we'll let you off with a broken hand and a warning. How about it woman?" You clench your fist and get ready to make a move if you have to.

"I didn't mean to trespass." you reply sternly but politely. "But I do intend to join the Gruul. If you are not able to approve my application I request that you take me to someone who can." The leader lets out another chuckle, but his two buddies remain silent this time.

"You know we can't just let you in, little girl. It's not that easy. If you truly wish to be one of us I'll take you to the leader of clan Blood Hunt. Our little subgroup is small compared to the others, but do not think that this will make for an easy trial. If our leader gives you a test you'll either pass it or die, no in-between. I'll give you one last chance to take the trespasser's punishment, what do you say?"

He lowers his knife and allows you to turn around fully to face him. You tighten your grip on your lantern and take a moment to look over your shoulder at the two elf men standing behind you. After a few seconds of thought you give him your reply...
14111.title: How Tough Are Ya?

choices: Ask the elf about his leader
Ask the elf about his clan
141111.content:
The elf man grins as he nods to his two followers, who step back and give you some room. "If nothing else you have some guts." he says as he walks over to join them. "That is a rare trait for a city dweller, perhaps you have a chance after all. Follow us and stay close, our camp isn't too far from here. Try to break away or run and we can't promise us or our fellows won't just hunt you down and kill you, understood?" You nod your head and follow as they lead you away from the tiny campsite and back into the thick forest.

You keep close and stay silent as the elves clear a path ahead. You figure that if you leaned back enough you could probably slip away, but they've already seen your face and know who you are. Even if you got away clean the Gruul would likely refuse to trust you after that, not something a potential member would want at all. You still keep your guard up though, no telling what awaited you in the untamed wilds ahead.

After several minutes of navigating through thick plant life and jagged hunks of ground the elves pull away a clump of moss to reveal a large Gruul camp in a clearing up ahead. There were about a dozen tents of various sizes similar to the ones you saw back at the elf camp along with a few wooden cages, bone piles, totems and a large pit near the center. "Very impressive." you say as the elf men lead you into the clearing. "If you like that wait until you see the people." one of the elf men calls as you follow them to the largest tent.

"Wait here." the leader instructs as one of his men follow him inside, leaving you alone with the other.
141111.title: Back At The Camp

choices: Head to the back and find a recruiter
Enjoy the party a bit and wait for a recruiter to find you
142.content:
You slowly pushed your way past the crowd of Rakdos partiers as you tried making your way to the back of the room to meet up with one of the local recruiters named Knife Boy. You had decided to join this guild the previous night and had spent all day getting ready. A small drunken goblin in a pair of pants stained with ale burps loudly as you shove him out of your way and nearly trip over a pair of figures in jester outfits making out on the floor near the blood fountain.

You wondered for a brief moment if this might have been a mistake, but you had already come this far and were determined to at least speak to a guild official before leaving. "Knife Boy? Is that you?" you call out upon spotting a fat man in crimson robes chewing on a piece of meat in the corner near the back hallway. His clothes looked fairly expensive, but were torn and shredded with decorative blades intertwined with the cloth. The man even had a few pins, rings and razors cutting into his own flesh in certain places.

The man swallows the meat and quickly downs a tankard of ale before addressing you. "Sorry my dear girl, but Knife Boy was killed earlier today during a fight, stabbed... with a spoon apparently." he says as he takes another huge bite out of his meat chunk. "Damn! Really? I was hoping to talk to him about joining the guild." you reply as you push past a woman in a black dress covered in bloodstains. "There are a few recruiters left in the back, I think. Might be dead now too though..." he giggles as he finishes off the last of his meat and begins licking the bone.
142.title: No Party Like A Rakdos Party...

1421.content:
After a few more minutes of shoving and pushing you finally manage to pull open the door leading to the back room. You quickly closed the door behind you and headed down the narrow stone hallway that leads to the recruiters chambers. At the end of the hall was another small wooden door, which you opened excitedly as you prepared to meet with one of the local guild leaders.

The inside of the room wasn't particularly large, but it immediately made an impression on you. The only light came from a few thin candles enchanted with magic to keep them burning with a soft red light. Along the walls were many torn and tattered Rakdos banners stained with blood and drink alike along with a few piles of skulls. In the center of the room was a large iron throne studded with spikes that were decorated with flags and more skulls. On that throne was a tall woman who was flanked by two large guards in leather straps and spiked armor.

The woman smiled upon seeing you come in and gestured for one of her guards to seat you at a small wooden table in front of her. "Hello, dearie. I'm Lilith, head of this branch of the Rakdos family since, oh, about fifteen minutes ago. I'm in charge of approving new members of our little organization." she says with a laugh as she sips from a goblet of wine. "That is why you're here, isn't it?"

You quickly nod your head and accept a goblet handed to you by the guard as he returns to his mistress. "Yes please, I would love to become a member of Rakdos." you reply as you take a drink from the goblet. The taste was bitter and strong, but the drink helped put your mind at ease.

"Good. Very good. I don't wish to bore you with details so I'll get straight to your task. If you complete this job you'll be made an initiate of the guild. A foolhardy member of the Boros has stolen a flask of my most prized brew, the Dragon Demon Mead. Get it back and deal with the troublemaker as you see fit. Until you finish don't return here, or else you'll end up like the last leader who sat in this chair before me... you are dismissed." Lilith commands as she claps her hands.

The two guards then escort you back to the front door, which they shut behind you after wishing you luck. You look down at a piece of paper that was handed to you on your way out, it seemed to be an address where you could find the mead thief. You don't waste any time and quickly head to...
1421.title: Need For Mead

choices: Try to talk your way in at the front desk
Get some reinforcements and storm the place
14211.content:
You head straight to the location given on the address parchment, which turned out to only be a few blocks away... right alongside the border to a large Boros controlled neighborhood. The stone building standing in front of you was an inn famous throughout this region of Ravnica. At nearly 300 feet in height it wasn't the tallest building around, but very well furnished and maintained. "I've heard of this place... The Slumbering Dragon Inn." you say as you check a wooden sign hanging out front.

Sure enough, the name was right there in bold lettering with the words "over 400 years of satisfaction" written in smaller print just under it. This was a place where diplomats, ambassadors and even guild leaders would stay and do business. It was very cozy and luxurious... and also very very expensive to stay at for just one night. "I doubt they'll just let me in the front without some sort of invite or a stack of gold." you muttered under your breath as you scoped the place out.

The building was very secure with guards posted at all of the doors and even a few Boros and Azorius officers making their rounds at designated checkpoints. Something big was happening here tonight, otherwise there wouldn't be nearly as much security. This made things more difficult, but also more fun. If you were going to be a member of the Rakdos the first thing you needed to do was get your hands dirty... but how?
14211.title: Enjoy Your Stay

choices: The public lounge on the top floor
142113.content:
You leave the Inn for several hours to go meet up with some of your fellow Rakdos revelers and return under the soft glow of the nearby street lamps. It didn't take much convincing for your brothers and sisters to realize what a fun night they could have by party crashing such a well known establishment with their own twisted brand of entertainment. All in all, you had about fifty new friends who were very VERY eager to be added to the guest list.

You let a sly smile creep across your face as the jesters and freaks light up their torches and pull out their knives. "You fine folks ready to give them a show?" you ask as you grab a spare knife and raise it to the crescent moon shinning above the rooftops. The crowd erupts in hollering and applause. "Then let's go!" you shout as some unfortunate guards approach to see what all the commotion is.

Before anyone can even get to the front door a volley of fireballs light up the night and set the streets ablaze. Several of the guards draw their swords as some of their brethren retreat to bring back reinforcements. In seconds both the Rakdos cultists and the city guard are engaged in a fierce battle with blood and embers flying everywhere. No one even notices you slip away from the main crowd as you slowly make your way closer to the building while dodging the occasional punch or spell blast.

A man with a frenzied goblin on his head stumbles past you and you hop over a woman in a clown costume slumped up against an abandoned wagon filled with broken pots. Suddenly, a chain of binding white mana flies through the air and nearly catches you as you make a run for the front door of the inn. Luckily, you manage to duck out of the way at the last second and the man who cast the spell is cut down by a woman in a mask wielding an iron battleaxe.

"That was close, but I'm almost there!" you mutter as a stumbling guard nearly knocks you over. The riot was going in full force now though, no one even sees you enter the broken front door as a fresh wave of fire and smoke sweeps across the bloodied road. You pause for a moment once inside to catch your breath and walk past a guy chewing on some sort of burnt meat as you make your way over to the stairs.

Where do you begin your search?
142113.title: Knock Knock!

1421132.content:
You immediately head upstairs to the guest quarters as more yells and screams echo from outside. You were certain you could hold your own in a small fight, but the riot outside would only last so long before the guards managed to retake control. If you weren't gone by the time that happens your odds of escaping with the mead would likely decrease to the point of near impossibility.

When you reach the second floor you take a quick look around the halls to make sure the area is clear enough to sneak in. To your immense surprise, it was. "I don't see any panicking guests...did someone rent out the whole place or something?" you ask to no one in particular, unsure if this was a good sign or a bad one.

You shrug your shoulders and walk over to the first room, which wasn't even properly locked. "This is gonna be too easy." you say as you quickly begin searching through the luxurious furniture for any signs of a hidden chest or safe. "Nothing here, maybe I should have hired a Dimir agent to help me? Those shadowy creeps could probably loot a needle from a whole field of hay if they wanted to."

You quickly move onto the next room and the next after that. Still no sign of the mead, though you did manage to "misplace" some very nice jewelry and a nifty magical ring from a lock box hidden under a bed. Outside you could hear the sounds of white mana chaining and binding people to the ground as the riot began to lose steam. "Just a bit longer..." you whisper as you move on to...
1421132.title: Room Service

choices: Hide in a room until they pass
Sneak away and try to tail them to get more information
14211322.content:
You groan in frustration as you head for the stairs. "I doubt that mead is down here in one of the cheap rooms, if a Boros agent got a hold of it he'd probably be keeping it in a luxury suite near the top floor." you say as you carefully creep up the stairs without making too much noise. "The riot's starting to die down already, I need to hurry up."

Soon you arrive on the penultimate floor just below the lounge and decide to conclude your search here, if you couldn't find that mead on this floor you'd have to make a hasty exit unless you planned on spending the next several hours talking to an Azorius interrogator. "Last stop." you whisper as you begin walking towards the first room.

Suddenly, you hear a voice come from around the corner along with the sound of footsteps climbing down stairs. It sounded like a Boros commander and one of his underlings talking about some sort of planned attack on Resistance territory. This was big news and you wanted to hear more, but they were coming right this way and would surely spot you if you stayed where you are. Time to make a hard decision...
14211322.title: Unexpected Guests

143.content:
You take a deep breath as you walk down the street towards the local chapter of the Izzet League, a guild famed for its amazing (and unpredictable) science experiments and studies. All your life you had sought to be more than just a common citizen in this massive city and now was your first big chance to show your dream guild what you were made of. A loud hissing sounds as the front gate opens in a puff of blue-tinted magical steam and red glowing tubes mounted on the walls show you the way forward.

After a few minutes of walking down the long entrance hallway you come across a wrecked pile of burnt scrap with a large lump of fresh goblin charcoal sitting in the middle of it and two scholarly looking mages investigating the mess. One is an older man with a thick grey beard and glasses in a red robe and the other is a young woman with long brown hair in a lighter blue robe. As you get closer you begin to hear what sounds like a snide argument going on between them...
143.title: FOR SCIENCE!

1431.content:
"Excuse me, what is going on here?" you ask as you walk up to the older man in the red robe. The two mages exchange one last quick glance at each other and the woman in the blue robe walks off. "Hmph, don't mind her, dearie. She's just upset that her theory had about a dozen holes punched through it by my superior intellect." the man replies as he turns to look over the charred remains of the goblin. "Can you you believe she thought that this goblin was struck by lightning? Indoors? Why, the fine folks over at the indoor shock study department should be quite offended at such a baseless allegation! Oh, my name is Rodrick by the way."

You raise an eyebrow as you look over the wrecked metal parts surrounding the goblin's remains. "Yeah, this guy looks like something a lot stronger than lighting hit him." you reply as you take a step back from the nasty burning smell. Rodrick laughs and slaps you gently on the back. "Right? Of course!" he says with unexpected excitement. "This poor fellow was clearly undone by an exploding steamcore automation from the boilerworks division! I'm glad to see a fellow mind of such caliber at this fine institution!"

You smile and rub the back of your head as you take another look at the burnt goblin. "Uh yeah, thanks. Listen, I'm still pretty new here and I don't want to be late. See you later." you reply as you begin to walk down the hall. "Ah yes, I look forward to our next encounter! Good day to you, young scholar!" he yells back as you hasten your pace a bit. Time to head to your station and get some work done...but what are you going to work on?
1431.title: An Explosive Personality

choices: A gentle cascade of water- soothing...
1432.content: "I told you your crazy idea would result in failure! Raw power can't solve everything. You need the beautiful precision of blue man's. Now, what do we have here?" She asked, seeing you out of the corner of her eye. " A new recruit? Delightful!" She exclaimed as the red mage glares at the charred mess. "Let me give you a basic test to find your specialty. We are currently in a high mana area, so try to focus your mana to cast a spell." Is your spell
1432.title: Talk to the blue mage

choices: Chat with the merfolk mage for a few minutes
Head immediately to your next assignment
144.content:
You took inventory of all of the beakers, test tubes, plants and cages that lined the mossy wall of a Simic-run warehouse near one of their most prominent research labs. The place was peaceful most of the time, but its proximity to Orzhov and Boros controlled neighborhoods made it a prime target for theft and vandalism. In a particularly brutal break in last mouth the guild even lost a tome filled with research notes and a vial of experimental ooze when someone killed the platefrog they had set to guard the place.

"All done sir, everything is accounted for except a few stray papers on plant mutagens and a list of seed types, both of which should be fairly easy to replace." you say as you walk over to the two elven men standing guard near the front door. One of them nods a confirmation at you and then turns back towards the stone wall out front and shifts his gaze back on the steel gate leading to the street. You let out a sigh as you rolled up your scrolls and began walking back towards the main lab entrance to drop off your work.

You had barely been with the guild for a week and already witnessed two break-ins along with the occasional rival guild member stopping by to taunt you or leave their mark on your walls and trees. Most of the damage done had been minor, but with last months incident and rising tensions with your fellow guild mates a conflict in the near future seemed like a sure thing. You wasted no time in dropping off your paperwork at the front desk where a merfolk mage was loading up clear slime bubble creatures with notes and letters and sending them on their way crawling up the walls and ceiling.

After watching your own scrolls disappear through a narrow hole in the wall along with the blue slimeball carrying them you decided to...
144.title: Taking Inventory

choices: A sweet and juicy hybrid fruit
A new type of amphibian that breeds in large qualities and tastes good roasted
A plant/animal mutation that can be farmed anywhere and grows its own seasonings
1443.content:
You still had a bit of work left to do, but it was just barely afternoon and there were plenty more hours left in the day to get it done. After spending so much time looking over various types of mutated plants and animals you had become quite hungry and headed towards a small courtyard just outside the main building to enjoy your lunch break. There were only a few of your fellow guild mates about so it was easy to find a good seat on a stone bench under a bright blue tree.

You had packed a lunch before leaving home, which also happened to be one of your primary experiments at the moment. Your superior in the guild had assigned you the task of creating and preparing a new type of food that the guild could use to raise funds for future projects. It didn't have to be perfect as many of the people in the area the Simic planned on selling it were already starving, though you would receive a nice bonus based on how well it sold.

You smiled as you pulled out your lunch satchel and admired your work. After nearly three days of sleepless work around the clock you had finally perfected a new recipe and were quite eager to sample the finished project before turning it in. The only question is, what type of food did you decide to create?
1443.title: Lunch Break

14431.content:
You hold up the pinkish-orange fruit with glee and peel the outer skin off to examine the inside. The interior was reddish-purple in color and smelled similar to the wild flowers that grew on the far edges of the city. You begin by tasting the skin, which was chewy and somewhat squishy, but very tasty...sort of like a banana mixed with a cherry or strawberry.

Next you took a large bite out of the insides, which were almost gel-like in composition. The fruit was tangy, slightly sour as well as sweet and nutritious enough to survive on easily. All things considered, it looked like your new species of fruit would be perfect for what the guild needed.

After finishing off the rest of your lunch you gather up all of your research on the new plant and make sure its properly organized before heading to your leader's laboratory. On your way there you noticed a depressed looking woman with green skin and six blue eyes looking over a scroll of some kind. Next to to her on a bench were a stack on tomes that looked like they were piled up in a hurry with no thought to organization.

"I wonder what she's so sad about..." you say as you look down at your own research.
14431.title: Extra Fruity

145.content:
You wake up in the early hours of the morning and dress in your new Golgari attire, eager to make a good impression on your first official day as an initiate in the massive Golgari swarm. The dripping of water and buzzing of insects could be heard all around you as you moved along a wide sewer passage into the main chamber of this undercity outpost, your path illuminated only by glowing fungus and a few strange bugs.

Your mentor for the time being was an elf man named Yirlosh, who was one of the more senior members of this particular rot farm and oversaw most of what went on from day to day. He was kind, but also strict and harsh to those that made mistakes or couldn't do their job properly.

He waved to you upon noticing you entering the main garden hall and called you over. "Hello little initiate, are you ready to begin your first day?" he asked as he stirred the muck beneath him with some sort of staff. "Yes, I'd like to begin my first task immediately." you reply as you cross your arms.

"Very good, what role do you think you'd handle best?" he asked as he lifted a skull from the muck and plucked a plant growing from its eye. You stood silently for a moment and thought about what your options were. You hadn't really expected to be given a choice and didn't want to get stuck doing something you'd hate. After a few seconds you decide to speak up and try being...
145.title: Dark, Dank And Deadly

choices: Ask for more information about her
1452.content: "A shaman? Excellent choice!" Exclaims Yirlosh. "You'll head down the tunnel to our left here, where arven will begin your training." Being no stranger to dark magic and death spells, you are unimpressed by the feel of the tunnels- until you feel a presence that is- quite literally- petrifying! You hear a raspy voice behind you- "Close your eyes, child. I wish to view the newest strength of my home guild." Moments later, you feel the presence dissipate. You slowly open your eys and continue through. As you reach the exit of the tunnel, you question the guard as to what that presence was. "As a soon-to-be shaman, I imagine you'll become very accustomed to her- that was Vraska, the strongest of our guild!" Do you-
1452.title: A shaman

14522.content:
You nod your head and thank the guard for the information before continuing onward. "Interesting, I've only been here a short while and I'm already meeting many fascinating people." you say to yourself as you walk up to a man wearing black and green face paint and beads.

"Ah, can I help you child?" the man whispers through wrinkled lips as his pale green eyes fall upon you. He looked to be about seventy or eighty years old with a long thin grey beard and thick eyebrows. Upon his bare chest and back he had painted several runes and magical symbols that shimmered every other second with a faint green glow.

"Hello sir, I'm looking for someone named Arven." you reply as you lean forward to bow. "I'm hoping to be trained in the ways of the shaman so that I might better serve the Swarm." The man smiles as he strokes his beard and looks away for a moment at a young woman skimming through the shallow sludge behind him. "Ah yes, I take it master Yirlosh sent you?" he asked as he beckoned for the young woman to come closer.

"Yes sir." you reply as the man pulls out a small satchel and hands it to you. "I'm afraid I just sent Arven to the upper chambers to fetch me some samples of all our fresh crops, it'll take quite a bit of time to get back here. Luckily, I myself am one of our most senior shamans and would be happy to instruct you for the time being. Does that sound agreeable?"

You nod your head and the man pulls a small bone knife out of the satchel he gave you and hands it to the young woman he just called over. "Hold this for a second, Xenda. We have a new shaman to welcome." he says cheerfully as he pulls a few tiny vials and pouches from the satchel. "There now. Looks like we have all of the ingredients...what shall old master Guvoi teach you about first?"

You think it over a moment and reply...
14522.title: Mystic Arts

choices: You try to summon an undead minion
You try to conjure a swarm of bugs
You try to create a small field of decay
145221.content:
Master Guvoi smiles as he puts a few of the vials and pouches back inside the satchel and takes the bone knife back from Xenda. "Ah, very good. We learn many ancient arts and techniques, but mastery over black and green mana is always at the center of our learning. Once you have unlocked the secrets of our power over life and death you will be ready to serve our guild properly." As he speaks Master Guvoi takes a vial of bright green slime and dips the tip of the bone knife into it.

"First you must learn the basics of proper spellcraft and how to harvest the ingredients to fuel it. Our particular branch of magic relies on mana the same as others, but to power the grandest spells you must know more than how to simply manipulate mana." At this point the elder shaman moves the blade to his hand and lightly slits his palm just enough to allow a few drops of blood to fall.

As the tiny beads of red liquid hit the floor they begin to softly glow with a faint dim green light. "I'll begin with something easy." Master Guvoi says as shadowy wisps encircle his bloodied hand. He kneels down and places his palm over the fresh blood and paints a small symbol with it. A few seconds pass before the blood abruptly stops glowing and turns pitch black it begins to take on a shadowy form.

You let out a light gasp as the tiny swirl of dark mist takes the shape of a large rat and slowly grows in size. In under a minute the shadows were gone and in their place was a skeletal rat the size of a small dog with raw red muscles exposed under its ragged grey fur. It's eyes glowed the same hue of green as the slime on the knife had and its crooked fangs dripped acidic drool that burned tiny holes were it dripped.

"Adorable, isn't he?" Master Guvoi said suddenly to break the silence. "This is a fairly basic necromancy spell that allows me to pull the minerals and residue of organic matter from the ground itself and reconstruct a functioning body with it. It has its limits for such a small mana cost, but an army of these basic soldiers can be surprisingly effective." With that Master Guvoi waved his hand to cancel the flow of energy powering the rat zombie and it quickly collapsed back into a pile of damp dust and sludge.

"Now let's see what you can do." he say cheerfully as he hands you the bone knife and goes over a few more basic spells you could perform. After going over your options you grip the knife tightly in your hand and begin your first attempt at a spell as an official Golgari shaman.
145221.title: The Magic Of Life And Death

choices: To the ruins of an old tomb
1452212.content:
You didn't want to just repeat the same spell as your teacher and summoning a swarm of insects sounded like a pretty useful thing to be able to do. You paint a rune on your hand and try to focus mana from the surrounding area into it, which was surprisingly difficult. Your hand began to glow faintly as you held it up in the musty air and tried to concentrate on collecting as much power as possible.

"Not a bad start." Master Guvoi said with a smile. "But you're trying way too hard. This undercity provides a wealth of both black and green mana, there is no need to strain yourself trying to pry it all from the stones and muck. Instead, relax and let the mana flow through you rather than try to force it. Become one with your own lifeforce and the death and decay surrounding it."

You nod and try to calm down a bit. Your palm begins to glow a bit brighter as the rune you drew flashes with energy. "It's working!" you think excitedly to yourself. "Now I just need to follow the master's instructions." You clench your fist into a swirling orb of life energy and whisper a short chant to boost the power of the summoning. Just as the light begins to fade you feel several tiny legs skittering about between your fingers.

Both you and Xenda gasp in awe as a swarm of tiny beetles begin pouring down the side of your arm and unto the floor. You then wave your hand and are pleased to see the swarm move in unison as the last of their number drop from your fingertips. "Ah, very well done young initiate." Master Guvoi exclaimed as you instructed the swarm to fly into the air. After a few minutes of messing around you then cut off the flow of magic and watch as the freed beetles fly away into a deeper chamber.

"Wow, that was pretty cool." Xenda says as Master Guvoi gives you both a pat on the back. "I have a feeling you both will make the Swarm very proud someday, but for now you still have much to learn. Shall we begin the next lesson?" You both nod and listen closely as Master Guvoi explains more about how mana and spells work. After about an hour he then asks you to follow him so that he can give you a more hands-on assignment.

Where does he lead you?
1452212.title: Pest Control
